parameter.description: Defines the PN offset that represents the "Physical cell identity" in CDMA2000 system, as specified by PhysCellIdCDMA2000 in SIB8 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.3.1}}.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Indicates the type of the cell. This parameter determines the length of the CID parameter.

parameter.name: CID
parameter.description: Defines the global cell identity of the cell. For a 1xRTT cell, the cell identity is a binary string 47 bits long. For a HRPD cell, the cell identity is a binary string 128 bits long. The value of {{param}} parameter is interpreted as 128-bit long unsigned integer. If {{param|Type}} is {{enum|1xRTT|Type}}, the first 47 bits (6 octet) is used and the rest of this {{param}} parameter MUST be ignored by the CPE. If {{param|Type}} is {{enum|HRPD|Type}}, the entire 16 octet is used as {{param}}. Corresponds to IE CellGlobalIdCDMA2000 specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.3.4}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.CSG.
object.description: This object provides monitoring of Closed Subscriber Groups (CSG) in the HeNB.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.CSG.Stats.
object.description: This object provides the LTE RAN CSG statistics as defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.32.453}}.

parameter.name: MeanNbrUsr
parameter.description: This measurement provides the mean number of attached CSG UEs in the HeNB.

parameter.name: AttInboundMobility
parameter.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted inbound mobility for UEs to CSG cells or hybrid cells in RRC_CONNECTED mode.

parameter.name: SuccInboundMobility
parameter.description: This measurement provides the number of successful inbound mobility for UEs to CSG cells or hybrid cells in RRC_CONNECTED mode.

parameter.name: FailedInboundMobility
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of failed successful inbound mobility for UEs to CSG cells or hybrid cells in RRC_CONNECTED mode by cause.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "cause name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the cause name= "sum".

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.RRC.
object.description: This object provides monitoring of the RRC in the HeNB.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.RRC.Stats.
object.description: This object provides the RRC statistics as defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.32.453}}.

parameter.name: AttConnEstab
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of RRC connection establishment attempts by cause.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "cause name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the cause name= "sum".

parameter.name: FailConnEstab
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of RRC establishment failures by cause.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "cause name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the cause name= "sum".

parameter.name: SuccConnEstab
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of successful RRC establishments by cause.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "cause name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the cause name= "sum".

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.ERAB.
object.description: This object provides monitoring of E-RABs in the HeNB.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.ERAB.Stats.
object.description: This object provides the E-RAB statistics as defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.32.453}}.

parameter.name: EstabInitAttNbr
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of initial E-RABs attempted to setup by QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: EstabInitSuccNbr
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of initial E-RABs successfully established QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: EstabInitFailNbr
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of initial E-RABs failed to setup by cause.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: EstabAttNbr
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of E-RABs attempted to setup by QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: EstabSuccNbr
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of E-RABs successfully established by QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: EstabFailNbr
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of E-RABs failed to setup by cause.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: RelEnbNbrQCI
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of E-RABs requested to release initiated by HeNB by QCI.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: RelEnbNbrCause
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of E-RABs requested to release initiated by HeNB by cause.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: LGWNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.ERAB.Stats.LGW.{i}.
object.description: This object provides statistics for the Direct User Plane Path between HeNB and Local Gateway as defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.32.453}}.

parameter.name: CorrelationID
parameter.description: The value of this parameter is equal to the user plane PDN GW TEID (GTP-based S5) or GRE key (PMIP-based S5). {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.401}}.

parameter.name: EstabDirectPathLGWAttNbr
parameter.description: This measurement provides the number of direct user plane path between HeNB and Local GW attempted to setup.

parameter.name: EstabDirectPathLGWSuccNbr
parameter.description: This measurement provides the number of direct user plane path between HeNB and Local GW successfully established.

parameter.name: EstabDirectPathLGWFailNbr
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the number of direct user plane path between HeNB and Local GW E-RABs failed to setup by cause.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "cause name=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.DRB.
object.description: This object provides monitoring of Data Radio Bearers (DRB) in the HeNB.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.DRB.Stats.
object.description: This object provides the DRB statistics as defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.32.453}}.

parameter.name: PdcpSduBitrateDl
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the average cell bit-rate of PDCP SDUs on the downlink. This represents the ingress rate of user plane traffic to the HeNB (via S1) by SAE Bearer QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: PdcpSduBitrateUl
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the average cell bit-rate of PDCP SDUs on the uplink. This represents successful transmissions of user plane traffic; control signalling and retransmissions are excluded from this measure. Measurement is by SAE Bearer QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: PdcpSduBitrateDlMax
parameter.description: This measurement provides the maximum cell bit-rate of PDCP SDUs on the downlink. This represents the maximum ingress rate of user plane traffic to the HeNB (via S1). This is a sum counter measured across all QCIs.

parameter.name: PdcpSduBitrateUlMax
parameter.description: This measurement provides the maximum cell bit-rate of PDCP SDUs measured on the uplink. This represents successful transmissions of user plane traffic; control signalling and retransmissions are excluded from this measure. This is a sum counter measured across all QCIs.

parameter.name: PdcpSduDelayDl
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the average (arithmetic mean) PDCP SDU delay on the downlink by ERAB Bearer QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: PdcpSduDropRateDl
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the fraction of IP packets (PDCP SDUs) which are dropped on the downlink by ERAB Bearer QoS level (QCI). Only user-plane traffic (DTCH) is considered. A dropped packet is one whose context is removed from the HeNB without any part of it having been transmitted on the air interface. Packets discarded during handover are excluded from the count.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: PdcpSduAirLossRateDl
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the fraction of IP packets (PDCP SDUs) which are lost (not successfully transmitted) on the downlink air interface by ERAB Bearer QoS level (QCI). Only user-plane traffic (DTCH) is considered. A lost packet is one whose context is removed from the HeNB after an attempt has been made to transmit part or all of the packet on the air interface but the whole packet has not been successfully transmittedafter an attempt has been made to transmit part or all of the packet on the air interface but the whole packet has not been successfully transmitted.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: PdcpSduLossRateUl
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the fraction of IP packets (PDCP SDUs) which are lost (not successfully received) on the uplink by ERAB Bearer QoS level (QCI). Only user-plane traffic (DTCH) and only PDCP SDUs that have entered PDCP (and given a PDCP sequence number) are considered.
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: UEActiveDl
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the average number of UEs that have user-plane (DTCH) data queued on the downlink by ERAB Bearer QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

parameter.name: UEActiveUl
parameter.description:
This measurement provides the average number of UEs that have user-plane (DTCH) data queued on the uplink by ERAB Bearer QoS level (QCI).
{{list| where each item is defined as the "QCI level=measurement value"}} The total of all the measurements is provided using the name= "sum".

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.RRU.
object.description: This object provides monitoring of the Radio Resource Usage in the HeNB.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.RAN.RRU.Stats.
object.description: This object provides the RRU statistics as defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.32.453}}.

parameter.name: PrbTotDl
parameter.description: This measurement provides the total usage, in {{units}}, of physical resource blocks (PRBs) on the downlink for any purpose.

parameter.name: PrbTotUl
parameter.description: This measurement provides the total usage, in {{units}}, of physical resource blocks (PRBs) on the uplink for any purpose.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.EnergySavings.
object.description: This object provides for the managment of energy savings capabilities in the HeNB.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: This attribute determines whether the energy saving function is enabled or disabled.

parameter.name: State
parameter.description: Specifies the status regarding the energy saving in the cell. This parameter is applicable when the value of {{param|Enable}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: NotAllowedTimePeriodNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.EnergySavings.ActivationCandidateCellsLoad.
object.description: This object is relevant if the cell acts as a candidate cell. This object indicates the traffic load threshold and the time duration, which are used by distributed energy saving algorithms to allow an ‘original’ cell to enter the energy saving state. Threshold and TimeDuration are applied to the candidate cell(s) which provide coverage backup of an original cell when it is in the energy saving state.

parameter.name: Threshold
parameter.description: PRB usage as a {{units}} {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.314}}. The threshold applies in the same way for a candidate cell no matter which original cell it will provide backup coverage.

parameter.name: TimeDuration
parameter.description: This parameter indicates how long the traffic in the candidate cell needs to have been below the threshold, in {{units}}, before any original cells which will be provided backup coverage by the candidate cell enters energy saving state.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.EnergySavings.DeactivationCandidateCellsLoad.
object.description: This object is relevant if the cell acts as a candidate cell. This object indicates the traffic load threshold and the time duration which is used by distributed energy saving algorithms to allow a cell to leave the energy saving state. Threshold and time duration are applied to the candidate cell when it provides coverage backup for the cell in energy saving state.

parameter.name: Threshold
parameter.description: PRB usage as a {{units}} {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.314}}. The threshold applies in the same way for a candidate cell, no matter for which original cell it provides backup coverage.

parameter.name: TimeDuration
parameter.description: This parameter indicates how long the traffic in the candidate cell needs to have been above the threshold, in {{units}}, to wake up one or more original cells which have been provided backup coverage by the candidate cell.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.LTE.EnergySavings.NotAllowedTimePeriod.{i}.
object.description:
This object provides a time period for which energy saving is not allowed.
This object can be used to prevent a cell entering energy saving state.
This object is valid on the specified day(s) and time of every week.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: This attribute determines whether the time period is enabled or disabled.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: Starting time for this time period formatted as "HH:MM:SS" in UTC.

parameter.name: EndTime
parameter.description: Ending time for this time period formatted as "HH:MM:SS" in UTC.

parameter.name: DaysOfWeek
parameter.description: {{list| that represents the days of the week that are effective for this time period}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to configuring the CDMA2000 FAP.

parameter.name: TunnelInstance
parameter.description:
If the referenced object is deleted, the parameter value MUST be set to an empty string.
In case of a multiple-radio-technology FAP product, each radio technology can have its own tunnels or share common tunnels. In the former case, {{param}} can contain a unique instance number. In the latter case, {{param}} under all radio technologies can have the same instance number.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to configuring the CDMA2000 1x FAP.

parameter.name: PCFPDSNNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MaxBatchPCFPDSNEntries
parameter.description: Maximum number of entries in the {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.BatchPCFPDSN.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: BatchPCFPDSNNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to RAN configuring the CDMA2000 1x FAP.

parameter.name: OneXSectorNID
parameter.description: SID for 1x. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: OneXSectorSID
parameter.description: NID for 1x . See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: OneXPZID
parameter.description: packet Zone ID for 1x packet calls

parameter.name: BaseID
parameter.description: Base station ID (needed in SPM). This is also the CellID. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: MaxNeighborListEntries
parameter.description: Maximum number of entries avaiable in {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.NeighborList.{i}.}}.

parameter.name: NeighborListNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.RF.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to RF configuration of the FAP.

parameter.name: RFCNFL
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a pair of 2-digit Band class number (as defined in {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0057}}) followed by 4-digit FL Radio Frequency Channel Number (RFCN). Self-configuration for RFCN is controlled by {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.RFCNFLSelfConfigEnable}}. If the FAP's self-configuration capability for RFCN is available and enabled, this parameter MAY contain more than one item and the FAP is expected to select one from the list for RFCNFLInUse.
If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter SHOULD contain only a single item.
An example value is "010001, 030500". If multiple items are specified, they are done in the order of preference.

parameter.name: RFCNFLBandInUse
parameter.description: The FL Band being used by the FAP. Self-configuration for Band and RFCN is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.RFCNFLConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.RFCNFLSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. If the self-configuration capability is available and enabled, this parameter indicates the value selected by the FAP among the choices provided in RFCNFL. If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter contains the first band class value in RFCNFL.

parameter.name: RFCNFLInUse
parameter.description: The FL RFCN being used by the FAP. Self-configuration for RFCN is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.RFCNFLConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.RFCNFLSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. If the self-configuration capability is available and enabled, this parameter indicates the value selected by the FAP among the choices provided in RFCNFL. If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter contains the first RFCN value in RFCNFL.

parameter.name: PilotPN
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a pilot PN offset in units of 64 PN chips. Self-configuration for pilot PN is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.PilotPNConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.PilotPNSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective.
If the FAP's self-configuration capability for Pilot PN Offset is available and enabled, this parameter MAY contain more than one item and the FAP is expected to select one from the list for PilotPNInUse. If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter SHOULD contain only a single item.
The multiplicity of the PN offset values can also be expressed by defining a range using ".." (two periods) between two values. In this case, the combination of two values defines the lower-bound and upper-bound of the range inclusive.
The order of the items has no significance.

parameter.name: PilotPNInUse
parameter.description:
The Pilot PN Offset being used by the FAP in {{units}}. Self-configuration for Pilot PN Offset is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.PilotPNConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.PilotPNSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. If the self-configuration capability is available and enabled, this parameter indicates the value selected by the FAP among the choices provided in PilotPN.
If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter contains the first value in PilotPN.

parameter.name: MaxFAPTxPower
parameter.description:
Defines the maximum transmission power allowed on the FAP. MaxFAPTxPower is expressed as a range of allowed maximum power levels with ".." (two periods)
between the upper and lower values, i.e. "<Pmax_low>;..<Pmax_high>;".
{{param}} identifies the limits between which the FAP can self-configure its maximum transmit power.
Self-configuration for maximum transmission power is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.MaxFAPTxPowerConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.MaxFAPTxPowerSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. <Pmax_low>; and <Pmax_high>; are measured in dBm and have a range of -40.0 to 20.0 incremented by 0.1 dB.

parameter.name: MaxFAPTxPowerInUse
parameter.description:
The maximum transmission power measured in {{units}} currently used by the FAP.
Actual values of the maximum transmission power are -40.0 dBm to 20.0 dBm in steps of 0.1 dB. The value of {{param}} divided by 10 yields the
actual value of the maximum transmission power.
Self-configuration for maximum transmission power is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.MaxFAPTxPowerConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.MaxFAPTxPowerSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. If the self-configuration capability is available and enabled, this parameter indicates the value selected by the FAP among the range provided in {{param|MaxFAPTxPower}}. If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter contains a value selected by the ACS.

parameter.name: PchPwrPercentage
parameter.description: Percentage of Max Sector Power Used By Paging Channel (expressed in {{units}}). For example, 93333 means 93.333% of the max sector power.

parameter.name: PilotPwrPercentage
parameter.description: Percentage of Max Sector Power Used By Pilot Channel (expressed in {{units}}). For example, 19950 means 19.95% of total.

parameter.name: SyncPwrPercentage
parameter.description: Percentage of Max Sector Power Used By Sync Channel (expressed in {{units}}). For example, 23458 means 23.4% of the max sector power.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.NetworkListenModeConfig.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to self-configuration of the MaxFAPTxPower of the FAP.

parameter.name: RFCNFLMargin
parameter.description: If self-configuration of RFCNFL is enabled, this value indicates the total received signal strength margin to be applied to the entries in RFCNFL when the FAP decides on the RFCNInUse in order to bias the selection of the most preferred frequency.

parameter.name: FAPCoverageTarget
parameter.description:
Defines the target value measured in dB for the range of the FAP's FL coverage, in terms of RF propagation loss. This value can be used by the FAP's selfconfiguration algorithms to help derive transmit power levels in the presence of co-channel and adjacent channel interference.
{{param}} is expressed as a range of the minimum coverage path loss and the maximum coverage path loss with ".." (two periods) between the minimum and maximum values, i.e., "<FAPCoverageTarget_min>..<FAPCoverageTarget_max>". These values can be used by the FAP's selfconfiguration algorithms to help derive transmit power levels in the presence of co-channel and adjacent channel interference.
<FAPCoverageTarget_min> and <FAPCoverageTarget_max> are measured in dB and have a range of [50,150] incremented by 1 dB.

parameter.name: FAPBeaconCoverageTarget
parameter.description:
Defines the target value measured in dB for the range of the FAP's FL Beacon coverage, in terms of RF propagation loss. This value can be used by the FAP's selfconfiguration algorithms to help derive beacon transmit power levels.
{{param}} is expressed as a range of the minimum coverage path loss and the maximum coverage path loss with ".." (two periods)
between the minimum and maximum values, i.e., "<BeaconCoverageTarget_min>..<BeaconCoverageTarget_max>". These values can be used by the FAP's selfconfiguration algorithms to help derive transmit power levels for the beacon(s) in the presence of co-channel and adjacent channel interference."
<BeaconCoverageTarget_min> and <BeaconCoverageTarget_max> are measured in dB and have a range of [50,150] incremented by 1 dB.

parameter.name: MaxCoverageEdgePilotStrength
parameter.description: The maximum strength of the received pilot energy per chip, Ec, to total received spectral density, Io (signal and noise) desired for FAP users at the edge of the FAP coverage target in units of {{units}}. This value can be used by the FAP's self configuration algorithms to help prevent aggressive transmit power level settings .

parameter.name: MaxAllowablePilotStrengthDegradation
parameter.description:
The maximum amount in dB by which the strength of the received pilot energy per chip, Ec, to total received spectral density, Io (signal and
noise) for alien users can be degraded in the presence of FAP interference at the edge of FAP coverage, in {{units}} units.

parameter.name: RFCNFLToProtect
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a FL RFCN corresponding to a CDMA2000 carrier that is adjacent to the RFCNFLInUse to be protected from adjacent channel interference. If any of the items in the list are adjacent to the FAP's own FL channel, the FAP MUST take the PilotStrength and total received power spectral density (Io) measured on these channels into account as part of its maximum transmit power selfconfiguration.
The RFCNs in the list can belong to any operator, allowing for protection of the FAP operator's own macro layer as well as that of other operators.
The list should take into account the ability of the FAP to self-configure its own FL RFCN and so SHOULD include any channels (requiring protection) which can potentially be adjacent to the RFCN selected by the FAP.
For example, if only adjacent operator protection is needed and the FAP has the ability to self-configure to any channel owned by its operator, this list would be populated with the RFCNs immediately above and below the range of channels owned by the FAP operator.
If an empty string then it indicates that there are no channels adjacent to the FAP that require protection, or that self-configuration of the FAP transmit power is not enabled.

parameter.name: FAPAllowedAdjChanCoverageHole
parameter.description: Defines the maximum allowed coverage hole created on carriers listed in RFCNFLToProtect by the FAP transmission, measured in {{units}}, in terms of RF propagation loss such that the {{param|MaxAllowablePilotStrengthDegradation}} is maintained outside the {{param}} for MS on that {{param|RFCNFLToProtect}}. This value can be used by the FAP's self configuration algorithms to help derive transmit power levels.

parameter.name: ACIR
parameter.description: AdjacentChannelInterferenceRatio value in {{units}} to be used when determining the coverage hole created on adjacent channels due to leakage.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.AccessParameters.
object.description: The object used for configuring access parameter messages for 1x. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: NomPwr
parameter.description: Nominal power correction factor used by the mobile in open loop power adjustment. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: InitPwr
parameter.description: Initial power offset used by the mobile in open loop power adjustment. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: PwrStepIndb
parameter.description: Power step increment in successive access probes. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: NomPwrExt
parameter.description: {{param}} should be zero for BC0 and BC1. For other band classes, {{param}} is 1 if Mobile's correction factor is between -24dBm and -9dBm. Otherwise {{param}} is zero. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: APMAuth
parameter.description: Enabling/disabling global authentication. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: APMRandUpdatePrd
parameter.description: The period (in {{units}}) that the BSS updates the RAND value sent via APM. Only 2 second multiples accepted.

parameter.name: Initialpwr
parameter.description: Initial power offset for access. The base station shall set this field to the correction factor to be used by mobile stations in the open loop power estimate for the initial transmission on an Access Channel, expressed as a two's complement value in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: PwrStep
parameter.description: Power increment. The base station shall set this field to the value by which mobile stations are to increase their transmit power between successive access probes in an access probe sequence, in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: NumStep
parameter.description: Number of access probes. The base station shall set this field to one less than the maximum number of access probes mobile stations are to transmit in a single access probe sequence.

parameter.name: MaxCapSize
parameter.description: Maximum Access Channel message capsule size. The base station shall set this field to the value in the range 0 to 7. {{param}} is set to three less than the maximum number of Access Channel frames in an Access Channel message capsule.

parameter.name: PreambleSize
parameter.description: Access Channel preamble length. The base station shall set this field to one less than the number of Access Channel frames that mobile stations are to transmit in each Access Channel preamble.

parameter.name: Psist09
parameter.description: Persistence value for access probes sent by mobiles with Access Overload calls values of 0 - 9. A value of 63 indicates such mobiles are not allowed to send access probes.

parameter.name: Psist10
parameter.description: Persistence value for access probes sent by mobiles with Access Overload calls values of 10 (test Mobile). A value of 7 indicates such mobiles are not allowed to send access probes.

parameter.name: Psist11
parameter.description: Persistence value for access probes sent by mobiles with Access Overload calls values of 11 (emergency Mobile). A value of 7 indicates such mobiles are not allowed to send access probes.

parameter.name: Psist12
parameter.description: Persistence value for access probes sent by mobiles with Access Overload calls values of 12. A value of 7 indicates such mobiles are not allowed to send access probes.

parameter.name: Psist13
parameter.description: Persistence value for access probes sent by mobiles with Access Overload calls values of 13. A value of 7 indicates such mobiles are not allowed to send access probes.

parameter.name: Psist14
parameter.description: Persistence value for access probes sent by mobiles with Access Overload calls values of 14. A value of 7 indicates such mobiles are not allowed to send access probes.

parameter.name: Psist15
parameter.description: Persistence value for access probes sent by mobiles with Access Overload calls values of 15. A value of 7 indicates such mobiles are not allowed to send access probes.

parameter.name: MsgPsist
parameter.description: Persistence modifier for access channel attempts transmitting a message.

parameter.name: RegPsist
parameter.description: Persistence modifier for registration message transmission.

parameter.name: ProbePNRan
parameter.description: Time randomization for access channel probes.

parameter.name: AccTmo
parameter.description: Access transmission timeout. Two less than the time the mobile has to wait before determining that the probe is not received by the BSS. It is in {{units}}.

parameter.name: ProbeBkoff
parameter.description: One less than maximum number for randomized delay between successive access probes in {{units}}.

parameter.name: Bkoff
parameter.description: One less than maximum number for randomized delay between successive access sequences in {{units}}.

parameter.name: MaxReqSeq
parameter.description: Maximum number of access probe sequences for an access request.

parameter.name: MaxRspSeq
parameter.description: Maximum number of access probe sequences for an access response

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.SystemParameters.
object.description: The object used for configuring system parameter messages for 1x

parameter.name: RegZone
parameter.description: registration zone number (refer to Section 2.6.5.1.5 of {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}})

parameter.name: TotalZones
parameter.description: Total number of zones the mobile shall retain for zone based registration. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: ZoneTimer
parameter.description: timer value to be used by the mobile in the zone registration timer. Refer to table 3.7.2.3.2.1-1 of the standard {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: RegPeriod
parameter.description: Registration period for timer based registration. Registration period is calculated from the formula 2^(REG_PRD/4) x 0.08 seconds. Thus a value of 59 corresponds to 1853.6 seconds (~ 1/2 hour). See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: SrchWinA
parameter.description: Search window size to be used ny the mobile for active set and candidate set. Refer to table 2.6.6.2.1-1 of {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}. For example, 11 corresponds to 130 chips

parameter.name: SrchWinN
parameter.description: Search window size to be used by the mobile for neighbor set. Refer to table 2.6.6.2.1-1 of {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}. For example, 8 corresponds to 60 chips

parameter.name: SrchWinR
parameter.description: Search window size to be used by the mobile for remaining set. Refer to table 2.6.6.2.1-1 of {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}. For example, 8 corresponds to 60 chips

parameter.name: NghbrMaxAge
parameter.description: neighbor set maximum age beyond which the mobiles are supposed to drop a neighbor. This is the count of neighbout list updat or extended neighbor list updates a mobile shall receive before removing a neighbor from the neighbor list. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: PwrRepThresh
parameter.description: Power control reporting threshold. Number of bad frames a mobile should receive before sending a PMRM message. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: PwrRepFrames
parameter.description: Duration (in number of frames) for measuring bad frames - given by equation 2^(PWR_REP_FRAMES/2) x 5 frames. For example, 6 corresponds to 40 frames. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: PwrThreshEnable
parameter.description: enable/disable power measurement report message. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: PwrPeriodEnable
parameter.description: enable/disable periodic power measurement report message. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: PwrRepDelay
parameter.description: Delay (in unit of four frames) following a PMRM before the mobile restarts counting bad frames for power control measuremnt. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: Rescan
parameter.description: If {{param}} is set to 1, the mobiles should restart and reinitialize the System Parameters message. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: Tadd
parameter.description: Power threshold (in {{units}}) for transferring a neighbor from neighbor set or remaining set to active set. For example, a value of 26 corresponds to -13 dB. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: Tdrop
parameter.description: Drop threshold (in {{units}}) to start a handoff timer to drop a neighbor from active or candidate set. For example, 30 corresponds to -15dB. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: Tcomp
parameter.description: If a pilot in condidate set exceeds the power of a pilot in active set by threshold, the mobile shall send a power strenght measurement report message. This threshold is defined in unit of {{units}}. For example, 5 corresponds to a threshold of 2.5 dB. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: TTdrop
parameter.description: Timer value for which an action is taken by the mobile for a neighbor in candidate set or in active set. Refer to Table 2.6.6.2.3-1 of the {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for details. For example, 3 corresponds to four seconds

parameter.name: InTrafficTadd
parameter.description: T-ADD value (in {{units}}) used for in-traffic system parameter message. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: InTrafficTdrop
parameter.description: T-Drop value (in {{units}}) used in in-traffic system parameter message. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: InTrafficTcomp
parameter.description: T_Comp value (in {{units}}) used for in-traffic system parameter message. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: InTrafficTtdrop
parameter.description: T_Tdrop timer value value used for in-traffic system parameter message. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.ExtendedSystemParameters.
object.description: The object used for configuring extended system parameter messages for 1x

parameter.name: Prev
parameter.description: protocol revision

parameter.name: PMinRev
parameter.description: minimum protocol revision

parameter.name: DeleteForTMSI
parameter.description:
Delete Foreign TMSI.
The base station shall set this field to '1' to cause the mobile station to delete its TMSI if the TMSI was assigned in a different TMSI zone from that specified by the TMSI_ZONE field of this message; otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: UseTMSI
parameter.description:
Use TMSI indicator.
The base station shall set this field to the value shown next field corresponding to the type of MSID that the mobile station is to use on the Access Channel.

parameter.name: PrefMSIDType
parameter.description:
Preferred Access Channel Mobile Station Identifier Type. F294.
The base station shall set this field to the value shown as below corresponding to the type of MSDI that the mobile station is to use on the Access Channel.
[useTMSI] [prefMSIDType] [description]
0 00 IMSI_S and ESN
0 10 IMSI
0 11 IMSI and ESN
1 10 TMSI; IMSI
1 11 TMSI; IMSI and ESN

parameter.name: MCC
parameter.description: Mobile Country Code. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: IMSI1112
parameter.description: 11th and 12th digits of IMSI. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: TMSIZoneLen
parameter.description:
TMSI zone length.
The base station shall set this field to the number of octets included in the TMSI_ZONE. The base station shall set this field to a value in the range 1 to 8 inclusive.

parameter.name: TMSIZone
parameter.description:
TMSI zone.
The base station shall set this field to the TMSI zone number as specified in {{bibref|3GPP2-N.S0010}}.

parameter.name: BcastIndex
parameter.description: Broadcast slot cycle index. To enable periodic broadcast paging, the base station shall set this field to and unsigned 3-bit number in the range 1-7, equal to the broadcast slot cycle index. To disable periodic broadcast paging, the base station shall set this field to '000'.

parameter.name: IMSITSupported
parameter.description: 1: IMISI_T is supported, 0: IMSI_T is not supported. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: SoftSlope
parameter.description: The slope in the inequality criterion for adding a pilot to the Active Set, or dropping a pilot from the Active Set. The base station shall set this field as an unsigned binary number.

parameter.name: AddIntercept
parameter.description: The intercept in the inequality criterion for adding a pilot to the Active Set. The base station shall set this field as a two's complement signed binary number, in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: DropIntercept
parameter.description: The intercept in the inequality criterion for dropping a pilot from the Active Set. The base station shall set this field as a two's complement signed binary number, in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: MaxNumAltSo
parameter.description:
Maximum number of alternative service options. The base station shall set this field to the maximum number of alternative service option numbers that the mobile station is allowed to include in the Origination Message or the Page Response Message.
For mobile stations with MOB_P_REVs less than seven, the alternative service options are those service options defined in TSB-58B and related to SERVICE_OPTION in Origination Message and the Page Response Message.
For mobile stations with MOB_P_REVs equal to or greater than seven, the alternative service options are those service options defined in TSB-58B without service group number assigned and related to SERVICE_OPTION in Origination Message and the Page Response Message.
The base station sets this field to a value greater than zero, in addition, the base station shall allow the mobile station with MOB_P_REVs equal to or greater than 7 to include
- a 4 or 8-bit service option bitmap in the Origination Message and the Page Response Message;
- alternative service option numbers, not limited to MAX_ALT_SO_NUM, in the Enhanced Origination Message.

parameter.name: ReselectedIncluded
parameter.description:
System reselection parameters included.
If the base station is including system reselection parameters, the base station shall set this field to '1'; otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: EcThresh
parameter.description:
Pilot power threshold.
If RESELECTINCLUDED is set to '1', the base station shall include the field EC_THRESH and set this field to:
[ (pilot_power_threshold + 115 ) ]
where pilot_power_threshold is the pilot power, Ec, in {{units}}/1.23 MHz, below which the mobile station is to perform system reselection; otherwise, the base station shall omit this field.

parameter.name: EcIoThresh
parameter.description:
Pilot Ec / Io threshold.
If RESELECTINCLUDED is set to '1', the base station shall include the field EC_I0_THRESH and set this field to:
[ - 20 x log10 (pilot_threshold) ]
where pilot_threshold is the pilot Ec/Io below which the mobile station is to perform system reselection; otherwise, the base station shall omit this field.

parameter.name: PilotReport
parameter.description:
Pilot reporting indicator.
The base station shall set this field to '1' if the mobile station is to report the additional pilots which have pilot strength exceeding T_ADD in all Access Channel messages. The base station shall set this field to '0' if the mobile station is to report the additional pilots which have pilot strengths exceeding T_ADD only in the Origination Message and the Page Response Message.

parameter.name: NghbrSetEntryInfo
parameter.description:
Neighbor Set access entry handoff information included indicator.
If the base station is including information on the Neighbor Set access entry handoff, the base station shall set this field to '1'; otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: AccessHOOrder
parameter.description:
Access entry handoff permitted indicator.
If NghbrSetEntryInfo is set to '1', the base station shall set this field to '1' if the mobile station is permitted to perform an access entry handoff after receiving a message while performing the Mobile Station Order and Message Processing Operation in the Mobile Station Idle State; otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: NghbrSetAccessInfo
parameter.description:
Neighbor Set access handoff included indicator.
If the base station is including information on the Neighbor Set access handoff or access probe handoff, the base station shall set this field to '1', otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: AccessHO
parameter.description:
Access handoff permitted indicator.
If NghbrSetEntryInfo is set to '1', the base station shall set this field to '1' if the mobile station is permitted to perform an access handoff; otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: AccessHOMsgRsp
parameter.description:
Access handoff permitted for message response indicator.
If AccessHO is set to '1', the base station shall include this field and set it as described below; otherwise, the base station shall omit this field.
The base station shall set this field to '1' if the mobile station is permitted to perform an access handoff after receiving a message and before responding to that message in the System Access State; otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: AccessProbeHO
parameter.description:
Access probe handoff permitted indicator.
If NghbrSetEntryInfo is set to '1', the base station shall set this field to '1' if the base station is permitted to perform an access probe handoff; otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: AccHOListUpd
parameter.description:
Access handoff list update permitted indicator.
If AccessProbeHO is included and is set to '1', the base station shall set this field to '1' if the mobile station is permitted to update the access handoff list during an access attempt; otherwise, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: AccProbeHOOtherMsg
parameter.description:
Access probe handoff permitted for messages other than the Origination Message and the Page Response Message.
If AccessProbeHO is set to '1', the base station shall set this field to '1' if the mobile station is permitted to perform an access probe handoff for messages other than the Origination Message and the Page Response. The base station shall set this field to '0' if the mobile station is permitted to perform an access probe handoff only for the Origination Message and the Page Response Message.

parameter.name: MaxNumProbeHO
parameter.description:
Maximum number of times that mobile station is permitted to perform an access probe handoff.
If AccessProbeHO is set to '1', the base station shall set this field to the maximum number of times the mobile station is allowed to perform an access probe handoff within an access attempt minus one.

parameter.name: BrdcastGPSAssit
parameter.description: If {{param}} is set to 1, then Braodcast GPS assist is supported. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: QPCHSupported
parameter.description:
Quick Paging Channel Supported Indication.
If the base station supports Quick Paging Channel operation, the base station shall set this field to '1'; otherwise the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: NumQPCH
parameter.description:
Number of Quick Paging Channels.
If the base station sets QPCHSUPPORTED to '1', the base station shall include this field and set it as described below; otherwise, the base station shall omit this field.
The base station shall set this field to the number of Quick Paging Channels on this CDMA Channel. The base station shall not set this field to '00'.

parameter.name: QPCHRate
parameter.description:
Quick Paging Channel indicator rate.
See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}. {{param}} is set as follows: 0: 4800bps; 1: 9600bps.

parameter.name: QPCHPwrLevelPage
parameter.description:
Quick Paging Channel paging indicator transmit power level.
{{param}} is set as follows: 0: 5 dB below; 1: 4 dB below; 2: 3 dB below; 3: 2 dB below; 4: 1 dB below; 5: Same; 6: 1 dB above; 7: 2dB above.

parameter.name: QPCHcciSupported
parameter.description:
Quick Paging Channel configuration change indicator supported.
{{param}} is set as follows: if the base station is to support configuration change indicators on the Quick Paging Channel, {{param}} to '1'; otherwise {{param}} is set to '0'.

parameter.name: QPCHPwrLevelConfig
parameter.description:
Quick Paging Channel configuration change indicator CONFIG transmit power level.
See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: SDBSupported
parameter.description:
Short Data Burst supported indicator.
See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: RLgainTrafficPilot
parameter.description:
Gain adjustment of the Reverse Traffic Channel relative to the Reverse Pilot Channel for Radio Configurations greater than 2.
{{param}} is set to the correction factor to be used by mobile stations in setting the power of a reverse traffic channel, expressed as a two's complement value in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: RvsPwrCtrlDelayIncl
parameter.description:
Reverse Power Control Delay included indicator.
See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: RvsPwrCtrlDelay
parameter.description:
The reverse power control delay.
{{param}} is setto the closed-loop reverse power control delay minus one (the closed-loop reverse power control delay is the time between the end of a gated-on reverse PCG and the beginning of the Forward Power Control Subchannel in units of {{units}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.ForwardPwrCtr.
object.description: The object used for configuring extended channel assignment messages for 1x

parameter.name: FPCFCHInitSetpt
parameter.description: Initial Fundamental Channel outer loop Eb/Nt setpoint in {{units}}. For example, 56 corresponds to 7 dB. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: FPCSubchanGain
parameter.description: Forward power control subchannel relative to fwd traffic channel in {{units}}. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: RLGainAdj
parameter.description: Reverse Traffic Channel power relative to access power in {{units}}. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: FPCFCHFER
parameter.description: Fundamental Channel target frame error rate. Refer to table 3.7.3.3.2.25-2 of {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}

parameter.name: FPCFCHMinSetpt
parameter.description: Minimum Fundamental Channel Outer Loop Eb/Nt setpoint in {{units}}. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: FPCFCHMaxSetpt
parameter.description: Maximum Fundamental Channel Outer Loop Eb/Nt setpoint in {{units}}. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.HardHandoff.
object.description: This object provides configurable parameters for 1x Handout

parameter.name: HandoutEnable
parameter.description: Enabling handout operation.

parameter.name: HOPilotPowerThresh
parameter.description: Pilot power threshold (in {{units}} relative to the FAP pilot power) for handout declaration

parameter.name: HOPilotDuration
parameter.description: Timethreshold for handout declaration (in {{units}})

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.HardHandoff.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for all Handouts of the 1x FAP.

parameter.name: TxHORequired
parameter.description: Total number of Handout Required messages sent to the MSC

parameter.name: RxHOCommand
parameter.description: Total number of Handout Command messegaes received from the MSC

parameter.name: HORequiredRejected
parameter.description: Total number of HO required requests rejected by the MSC

parameter.name: HORequiredUnanswered
parameter.description: Total number of HO required requests for which no response received from the MSC

parameter.name: TxUHDM
parameter.description: Total number UHDMs sent to mobiles

parameter.name: RxNSAck
parameter.description: Total number of MSAcks received from the mobile in response to UHDM

parameter.name: HOFailureCount
parameter.description: Total number of Handout attempts declared as failure

parameter.name: CallDropCount
parameter.description: Total numer of call drops after a HO attempt. RTC lost without MSack

parameter.name: TxHOCommence
parameter.description: Number of Handout Commenced messages sent to MSC

parameter.name: RxHOSessionClear
parameter.description: Number of session clear commands received form the core

parameter.name: ReturnOnFailureCount
parameter.description: Total number of times a Return On Handoff failure was declared

parameter.name: OnePilotReportCount
parameter.description: Number of times only one pilot was reported in HO Required message

parameter.name: TwoPilotReportCount
parameter.description: Number of times only two pilot was reported in HO Required message

parameter.name: ThreePilotReportCount
parameter.description: Number of times only three pilot was reported in HO Required message

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.PowerControl.
object.description: Configuration Managed Object for OTA power control attribute.

parameter.name: OneXPCFPCIncl
parameter.description: Whether Forward power control information included in Power Control message

parameter.name: OneXPCFPCFCHMinSetpt
parameter.description: The value for the minimum Fundamental Channel Outer Loop Eb/Nt setpoint, in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: OneXPCFPCFCHMaxSetpt
parameter.description: The value for the maximum Fundamental Channel Outer Loop Eb/Nt setpoint, in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: OneXPCRPCIncl
parameter.description: Whether reverse Power control information included in the Power Control Message.

parameter.name: OneXPCFCHChanAdjGain
parameter.description: Channel adjustment gain (in {{units}}) for Reverse Fundamental Channel.

parameter.name: OneXPCPwrRepThresh
parameter.description: The number of bad frames to be received in a measurement period on the channel which carries the Power Control Subchannel before mobile stations are to generate a Power easurement Report Message

parameter.name: OneXPCPwrRepFrames
parameter.description: Power control reporting frame count. Number of frames over which the mobile station measures frame errors. For example, 7 corresponds to 55 frames. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for mapping between this value and the actual frame count.

parameter.name: OneXPwrThreshEnable
parameter.description: Threshold report mode indicator. If the mobile station is to generate threshold Power Measurement Report Messages, the base station shall set this field to '1'. If the mobile station is not to generate threshold Power Measurement Report Messages, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: OneXPCPwrPeriodEnable
parameter.description: Periodic report mode indicator. If the mobile station is to generate periodic Power Measurement Report Messages, the base station shall set this field to '1'. If the mobile station is not to generate periodic Power Measurement Report Messages, the base station shall set this field to '0'.

parameter.name: OneXPCPwrRepDelay
parameter.description: Power report delay. The period that the mobile station waits following a Power Measurement Report Message before restarting frame counting for power control purposes. The base station shall set this field to the power report delay values in units of {{units}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.NeighborList.{i}.
object.description: This object contains information common to all neighbors of a sector. This object has only one instance.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: PilotInc
parameter.description: pilot increment policy for this network. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: OneXNeighborIndex
parameter.description: Macro neighbour index. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: NeighborConfig
parameter.description: Neighbor configuration in terms of number of frequencies having paging channels as defined in Section 3.7.2.3.2 of the {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} standard

parameter.name: NeighborPN
parameter.description: PN offset of the neighbor. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: SearchPriority
parameter.description: priority level for serching this neighbor. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: NeighborBand
parameter.description: Neighbor band class. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: NeighborFrequency
parameter.description: frequency of neighbor. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: FrequencyIncluded
parameter.description: Flag to indicate if the channel id included. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: InTraffic
parameter.description: whether this neighbor can be used for in-traffic neighborlist message

parameter.name: OverheadMsg
parameter.description: whether this neighbor can be used for overhead neighborlist message

parameter.name: BaseIdentifier
parameter.description: unique identifire of the neighboring cell (optional)

parameter.name: AirInterface
parameter.description: Air interface technology of the neighbor.

parameter.name: HandOutCapable
parameter.description: Flag to indicate if the handOutCapability is possible.

parameter.name: OneXNeighborLongitude
parameter.description: Longitude for this neighbor. Parameter is a string representing a floating point real number (+/- XXX.YY). Where + for East, - for West, XXX.Y ranges between 0.0 and 180.0 .

parameter.name: OneXNeighborLatitude
parameter.description: Lattitude for this neighbor. Parameter is a string representing a floating point number (+/-XX.Y). + for North, - for South, XX.Y ranges between 0.0 and 90.0.

parameter.name: OneXNeighborMSCId
parameter.description: IOS MSCID of the neighbors. See {{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0014}}.

parameter.name: OneXNeighborIOSCellId
parameter.description: Cell Identifier of the neighbor (formatted according to Cell Identification Discriminator = '0000 0010', i.e., 12-bit cell value and 4-bit sector value). See {{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0014}}.

parameter.name: ForceInOverhead
parameter.description: If {{param}} is set to {{true}}, the FAP SHOULD include this Neighbor List entry in the Neighbor List overhead messages (see {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}. Otherwise, {{param}} is set to {{false}}, in which case the FAP MAY include this Neighbor List entry in the Neighbor List overhead messages.

parameter.name: IncludedInOverhead
parameter.description: If {{param}} is set to {{true}}, the FAP is currently including this Neighbor List entry in the Neighbor List overhead messages (see {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}. Otherwise, {{param}} is set to {{false}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.APIDM.
object.description: This object can be configured only if {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.FemtoOverheadMessagesCapable}} is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: AssociationType
parameter.description: The FAP shall set this field to the value shown in {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} corresponding to the configuration of the base station.

parameter.name: APIDLEN
parameter.description: The FAP shall set this field to the length of the access point identification in units of 16 bits. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: APID
parameter.description: Access Point Identification. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: APIDMASK
parameter.description: Access Point identification Mask. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: IOSMSCID
parameter.description: MSC_ID of the base station. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: IOSCELLID
parameter.description: CELL_ID of the base station. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTRAFREQHOHYSINCL
parameter.description: This field indicates whether the INTRAFREQHOHYS field is valid and included in Access Point Identification message. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTRAFREQHOHYS
parameter.description: Intra Frequency Handoff Hysteresis. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTRAFREQHOSLOPEINCL
parameter.description: This field indicates whether the INTRAFREQHOSLOPE field is valid and included in Access Point Identification message. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTRAFREQHOSLOPE
parameter.description: Intra Frequency Handoff Slope. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTERFREQHOHYSINCL
parameter.description: This field indicates whether the INTERFREQHOHYS field is valid and included in Access Point Identification message. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTERFREQHOHYS
parameter.description: Inter frequency handoff hysteresis. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTERFREQHOSLOPEINCL
parameter.description: This field indicates whether the INTERFREQHOSLOPE field is valid and included in Access Point Identification message. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTERFREQHOSLOPE
parameter.description: Inter frequency handoff slope. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTERFREQSRCHTHINCL
parameter.description: This field indicates whether the INTERFREQSRCHTH field is valid and included in Access Point Identification message. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definition.

parameter.name: INTERFREQSRCHTH
parameter.description: Inter-frequency search threshold. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.APIDTM.
object.description: This object can be configured only if {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.FemtoOverheadMessagesCapable}} is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: APIDTEXTCHARiLEN
parameter.description: Access Point identification Text CHARi field Length ({{param|APIDTEXTCHARi}}). Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APIDTEXTMSGENCODING
parameter.description: Access Point identification Text message encoding. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} and {{bibref|3GPP2-C.R1001}} for definitions

parameter.name: APIDTEXTCHARi
parameter.description: Access Point Identification Text. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} and {{bibref|3GPP2-C.R1001}} for definitions.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.APPIM.
object.description: This object can be configured only if {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.FemtoOverheadMessagesCapable}} is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: LIFETIME
parameter.description: Lifetime of the information in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: NUMAPPIREC
parameter.description: The number of entries for {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.APPIM.APPIREC.{i}.}}

parameter.name: APPIRECNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.RAN.APPIM.APPIREC.{i}.
object.description: This object can be configured only if {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.FemtoOverheadMessagesCapable}} is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: APASSNTYPE
parameter.description: Access point association type the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APSIDSAMEASPREVIOUS
parameter.description: SID same as previous indicator in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APNIDSAMEASPREVIOUS
parameter.description: NID same as previous indicator in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APBANDSAMEASPREVIOUS
parameter.description: Bandclass same as previous indicator in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APFREQSAMEASPREVIOUS
parameter.description: Frequency same as previous indicator in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APPNRECSAMEASPREVIOUS
parameter.description: PN offset same as previous indicator in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APSID
parameter.description: Access point SID in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APNID
parameter.description: Access point NID in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APBAND
parameter.description: Access point bandclass in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APFREQ
parameter.description: Access point frequency in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APPNRECTYPE
parameter.description: Access point PN offset in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APPNRECLEN
parameter.description: Length in octets of the access point PN record ({{param|APPNREC}}) in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

parameter.name: APPNREC
parameter.description: Access point PN Record in the access point pilot information record. Refer {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}} for definitions

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.PCFConfig.
object.description: CDMA2000 1x PCF configuration information.

parameter.name: PCFPDSNHealthMonitorInterval
parameter.description: PDSN health check monitor interval in {{units}}. Setting the value to 0 disables the PDSN Health Monitoring Feature. Setting any non-zero value enables the PDSN Health Monitoring Feature and sets that non-zero value as the timer interval.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.PCFConfig.PCFPerformanceStats.
object.description: This object is used in obtaining the PCF stats

parameter.name: A10SetupFailureNoReason
parameter.description: Number of times the PCF was refused an A10 connection with an unspecified reason (A11 error code : 0x80)

parameter.name: A10SetupFailureAdminProhibit
parameter.description: Number of times the PCF was refused an A10 connection with a reason "Admin Prohibited" (A11 error code : 0x81).

parameter.name: A10SetupFailureInsuffResources
parameter.description: Number of times the PCF was refused an A10 connection with a reason "Insufficient Resources" (A11 error code: 0x82).

parameter.name: A10SetupFailureFailedAuth
parameter.description: Number of times the PCF was refused an A10 connection with a reason "Mobile Node Authentication Failure" (A11 error code: 0x83).

parameter.name: A10SetupFailureIdMismatch
parameter.description: Number of times the PCF was refused an A10 connection with a reason "Id Mismatch" (A11 error code: 0x85)

parameter.name: A10SetupFailureMalformedReq
parameter.description: Number of times the PCF was refused an A10 connection with a reason "Malformed Request" (A11 error code: 0x86)

parameter.name: A10SetupFailureUnknownPDSN
parameter.description: Number of times the PCF was refused an A10 connection with a reason "Unknown PDSN" (A11 error code: 0x88)

parameter.name: A10SetupFailureUnsuppVendId
parameter.description: Number of times the PCF was refused an A10 connection with a reason "Unsupported Vendor Id" (A11 error code: 0x89)

parameter.name: TotalA10ClosedByRnc
parameter.description: Number of A10 closed by the FAP RNC.

parameter.name: TotalA10ClosedByPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 closed by the PDSN.

parameter.name: TotalA10SuccessPages
parameter.description: Numebr of A10 Pages initiated by PCFsucceeded.

parameter.name: TotalA10FailedPages
parameter.description: Numebr of A10 Pages initiated by PCF failed.

parameter.name: TotalA10IngressBytes
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} received from the PDSN.

parameter.name: TotalA10EgressBytes
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} transmitted to the PDSN

parameter.name: A10RegUpdateReceived
parameter.description: Number of A10 Registration updates received by the FAP PCF

parameter.name: TotalA10DroppedPages
parameter.description: Number of A10 Pages initiated by PCF dropped

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.BatchPCFPDSN.{i}.
object.description: The Batch configuration Object used to configure PDSN table using a start and end IP address. The order of the address is used as part of PDSN selection algorithm, e.g., the first element is considered PDSN number 0. (Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0013}}). To get individual PDSN entries use the {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.PCFPDSN.{i}.}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: BatchTableNumber
parameter.description: The BatchTable Number should be given only once during the creation of a Batch Table. This is the Key Attribute that uniquely identifies a BatchTable entry. This number indicates the index of this batch to determine the PDSN number in the PDSN selection algorithm ({{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0013}}).

parameter.name: BatchTableStartIPAddress
parameter.description: Start IP address of the range of PDSNs.

parameter.name: BatchTableEndIPAddress
parameter.description: End IP address of the range of PDSNs.

parameter.name: BatchTableSecurityParameterIndex
parameter.description: Security Parameter Index to be used.

parameter.name: BatchTableSecretKey
parameter.description: Secret key in 32-digit hexidecimal representation.

parameter.name: BatchTableIOSVersion
parameter.description: IOS Version of this PDSN.

parameter.name: BatchTablePDSNAdminStatus
parameter.description: Administrative status of this PDSN. 0- UP 1-DOWN.

parameter.name: PDSNType
parameter.description: Indicates the PDSN type for this batch.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.PCFPDSN.{i}.
object.description: PCFPDSN Object configured for 1x. {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.BatchPCFPDSN.{i}.}} table should be used to configure PDSN details.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: PDSNNumber
parameter.description: Index of this PDSN object in the PCFPDSNCollection array. The index is used as PDSN number in PDSN selection algorithm. ({{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0013}})

parameter.name: SecurityParameterIndex
parameter.description: Security Parameter Index used

parameter.name: SecurityKey
parameter.description: Secret key in 32-digit hexidecimal representation.

parameter.name: IOSVersion
parameter.description: HRPD IOS Version of this PDSN.

parameter.name: PDSNadminStatus
parameter.description: Administrative status of this PDSN. 0- UP 1-DOWN.

parameter.name: PDSNHealthStatus
parameter.description: Reachability status of this PDSN. 0-unreachable, 1-reachable.

parameter.name: PDSNIPAddress
parameter.description: IP address of the PDSN.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.PCFPDSN.{i}.A11RegUpdateStats.
object.description: This object is used in obtaining the A11 Registration Update stats for each PDSN

parameter.name: PDSNNumberRegUpdatePerf
parameter.description: The PDSN Number

parameter.name: PDSNIPAddressRegUpdatePerf
parameter.description: The IP Address of the PDSN for which the A11 Reg Update stats is obtained

parameter.name: A11RegUpdateReceivedPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 Reg-update messages receieved from a PDSN

parameter.name: A11RegUpdateIDCheckFailPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 Reg-Update messages receieved from a PDSN that failed ID validation

parameter.name: A11RegUpdateAuthCheckFailPDSN
