object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.OneX.Redirect.
object.description: CDMA2000 1x service redirection parameters.

parameter.name: RedirectChannelNumber
parameter.description: The channel number set from ACS that the FAP uses to redirect the MS in case of closed access or when exceeding session capacity. The ACS shall push this if the the operator has provided this information in a configuration file. If this is not configured, the FAP rejects the AT. The supported range is 0..2047.

parameter.name: RedirectBandClass
parameter.description: The bandclass set from ACS that the FAP uses to redirect the MS incase of closed access or when exceeding session capacity. The ACS shall push this if the the operator has provided this information in a configuration file. If this is not configured, the FAP rejects the MS. The supported range is 0..9.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.
object.description: The object contains attributes related to HRPD.

parameter.name: PCFPDSNNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MaxBatchPCFPDSNEntries
parameter.description: Maximum number of entries in the {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.BatchPCFPDSN.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: BatchPCFPDSNNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.RAN.
object.description: The object contains attributes related to HRPD RAN.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.RAN.RF.
object.description: Contains the details related to HRPD RF

parameter.name: HRPDCarBandClass
parameter.description: The Band Class this HRPD Carrier object is to operate on. Reference - {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0057}}, Band Class Specification for CDMA2000 Spread Spectrum Systems.

parameter.name: RFCNFL
parameter.description: {{list}} Each item is a FL Radio Frequency Channel Number (RFCN). Self-configuration for RFCNFL is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.RFCNFLConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.RFCNFLSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. If the FAP's self-configuration capability for RFCNFL is available and enabled, this parameter MAY contain more than one item and the FAP is expected to select one from the list for {{param|RFCNFLInUse}}. If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter SHOULD contain only a single item. If multiple items are specified, they are done in the order of preference.

parameter.name: RFCNFLInUse
parameter.description:
The FL RFCN being used by the FAP. Self-configuration for RFCNFL is controlled by
{{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.RFCNFLConfig}} from an availability perspective and
{{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.RFCNFLSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. If the self-configuration capability is available and enabled, this parameter indicates the value selected by the FAP among the choices provided in {{param|RFCNFL}}. If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter contains the first value in {{param|RFCNFL}}.

parameter.name: PilotPN
parameter.description:
{{list}} (maximum length 32) (minimum 1 items) of strings. Each item is a pilot PN offset in units of 64 PN chips. Self-configuration for pilot PN is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.PilotPNConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.PilotPNSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective.
If the FAP's self-configuration capability for Pilot PN Offset is available and enabled, this parameter MAY contain more than one item and the FAP is expected to select one from the list for {{param|PilotPNInUse}}. If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter SHOULD contain only a single item.
The multiplicity of the PN offsets values can also be expressed by defining a range using ".." (two periods) between two values. In this case, the combination of two values defines the lower-bound and upper-bound of the range inclusive.
The order of the items has no significance.

parameter.name: PilotPNInUse
parameter.description:
The Pilot PN Offset being used by the FAP. Self-configuration for Pilot PN Offset is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.PilotPNConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.PilotPNSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. If the self-configuration capability is available and enabled, this parameter indicates the value selected by the FAP among the choices provided in {{param|PilotPN}}.
If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter contains the first value in {{param|PilotPN}}.

parameter.name: MaxFAPTxPower
parameter.description:
Defines the maximum transmission power allowed on the FAP. {{param}} is expressed as a range of allowed maximum power levels with ".." (two periods) between the upper and lower values, i.e. "<;Pmax_low>..<;Pmax_high>".
{{param}} identifies the limits between which the FAP can self-configure its maximum transmit power.
Self-configuration for maximum transmission power is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.MaxFAPTxPowerConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.MaxFAPTxPowerSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. <;Pmax_low> and <;Pmax_high> are measured in dBm and have a range of -40.0 to 20.0 incremented by 0.1 dB.

parameter.name: MaxFAPTxPowerInUse
parameter.description:
The maximum transmission power measured in {{units}} currently used by the FAP.
Actual values of the maximum transmission power are -40.0 dBm to 20.0 dBm in steps of {{units}}. The value of {{param}} divided by 10 yields the actual value of the maximum transmission power.
Self-configuration for maximum transmission power is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.MaxFAPTxPowerConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.HRPD.SelfConfig.MaxFAPTxPowerSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. If the self-configuration capability is available and enabled, this parameter indicates the value selected by the FAP among the range provided in {{param|MaxFAPTxPower}}. If the self-configuration capability is not available or not enabled, then this parameter contains a value selected by the ACS.

parameter.name: ControlChannelRate
parameter.description: The data rate of the Control Channel of this HRPD SectorElement object. Reference - {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification, section-10.4.1.3.2.4

parameter.name: SyncCapsuleOffset
parameter.description: The offset from the control channel cycle boundary at which the synchronous capsules are to be transmitted for this HRPD SectorElement object. Reference -{{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification, section-9.2.6.1.4.1.2

parameter.name: RabLength
parameter.description: The Reverse Activity Bit (RAB) length measured in slots for this HRPD SectorElement object. Reference -{{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification, section-7.8.6.2.2, Table 9.7.6.2-2.

parameter.name: RabOffset
parameter.description: The Reverse Activity Bit (RAB) offset for this HRPD SectorElement object. Reference - {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification, section-7.8.6.2.2.

parameter.name: SectorID
parameter.description: The 128 bit Sector ID for this HRPD SectorElement object. The Sector ID is used in the computation of the long code mask. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification.

parameter.name: ColorCode
parameter.description: The HRPD color code associated with this sector-element. Reference -{{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification

parameter.name: SubnetMaskLength
parameter.description: {{param}} is the length of the HRPD SubnetMask in {{units}}. See {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification

parameter.name: HRPDSecElReverseLinkSilenceDuration
parameter.description: Duration of the Reverse Link Silence Interval in units of {{units}}. The duration of the silence interval to be maintained on the reverse link. Reference -{{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification. Section-9.4.6.1.4.1.1.

parameter.name: HRPDSecElReverseLinkSilencePeriod
parameter.description:
The Reverse Link Silence Interval is defined as the time interval of duration ReverseLinkSilenceDuration frames that starts at times T where T is the CDMA System Time in units of {{units}} and it satisfies the following equation:
T mod (2048 x 2^(ReverseLinkSilencePeriod) - 1) = 0.
The period in the access cycle duration for which the silence interval shall be maintained on the reverse link. {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification. Section-9.4.6.1.4.1.1.

parameter.name: OpenLoopAdjust
parameter.description: The open loop adjustment (in {{units}}) for the access parameters of this sector-element. FAP sets this field to the negative of the nominal power to be used by ATs in the open loop power estimate, expressed as an unsigned value in units of 1 dB. The value used by the AT is -1 times the value of this field. Reference -{{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification. Section-9.4.6.2.6

parameter.name: ProbeInitialAdjust
parameter.description: The probe initial adjustment (in {{units}}) for the access parameters of this sector-element. FAP sets this field to the correction factor to be used by ATs in the open loop power estimate for the initial transmission on the Access Channel, expressed as a two's complement value in units of 1 dB. Reference -{{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification. Section-9.4.6.2.6

parameter.name: ProbeNumSteps
parameter.description: The number of power level steps for access probes for the access parameters of this sector-element. FAP sets this field to the maximum number of access probes ATs are to transmit in a single access probe sequence. The access network shall set this field to a value in the range [1 ... 15]. Reference -{{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification. Section-9.4.6.2.6

parameter.name: ProbePowerStep
parameter.description: The power step size (in {{units}}) applied to successive probes on the access channel associated with this sector-element. Probe power increase step. FAPsets this field to the increase in power between probes, in resolution of 0.5 dB. Reference -{{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification. Section-9.4.6.2.6

parameter.name: APersistence
parameter.description: The A-Persistence vector, as per HRPD specification, for controlling contention access on the access channel associated with this sector-element. Reference - {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024-B}}, CDMA2000 High Rate Packet Data Air Interface Specification. Section-9.4.6.2.6. Format is "0xAABBCCDD", where AA, BB, CC, DD are in the range "01" through "3F" hex.

parameter.name: RSSIRABThreshold
parameter.description: RAB threshold for RSSI based RAB algorithm.

parameter.name: LoadRABThreshold
parameter.description: RAB threshold for Load based RAB algorithm in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: ConnectionRateLimit
parameter.description: 4 different configurations.

parameter.name: RfeRLBalanceRatio
parameter.description: Config Parameter for DRC based rate control

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.BatchPCFPDSN.{i}.
object.description: The Batch configuration Object used to configure PDSN table using a start and end IP address. The order of the address is used as part of PDSN selection algorithm, e.g., the first element is considered PDSN number 0 (refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0008}} and {{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0009}}). To get individual PDSN entries use the {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.PCFPDSN.{i}.}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: BatchTableNumber
parameter.description: The BatchTable Number should be given only once during the creation of a Batch Table. This is the Key Attribute that uniquely identifies a BatchTable entry

parameter.name: BatchTableStartIPAddress
parameter.description: Start IP address of the range of PDSNs

parameter.name: BatchTableEndIPAddress
parameter.description: End IP address of the range of PDSNs

parameter.name: BatchTableSecurityParameterIndex
parameter.description: Security Parameter Index to be used

parameter.name: BatchTableSecretKey
parameter.description: Secret key in 32-digit hexidecimal representation.

parameter.name: BatchTableIOSVersion
parameter.description: HRPD IOS Version of this PDSN

parameter.name: BatchTablePDSNAdminStatus
parameter.description: Administrative status of this PDSN. 0- UP 1-DOWN.

parameter.name: PDSNType
parameter.description: Indicates the PDSN type for this batch.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.PCFPDSN.{i}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: PDSNNumber
parameter.description: Index of this PDSN object in the PCFPDSNCollection array. The index is used as PDSN number in PDSN selection algorithm (refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0008}} and {{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0009}})

parameter.name: SecurityParameterIndex
parameter.description: Security Parameter Index used

parameter.name: SecurityKey
parameter.description: Secret key in 32-digit hexidecimal representation.

parameter.name: IOSVersion
parameter.description: HRPD IOS Version of this PDSN

parameter.name: PDSNadminStatus
parameter.description: Administrative status of this PDSN. 0- UP 1-DOWN.

parameter.name: PDSNHealthStatus
parameter.description: Reachability status of this PDSN. 0-unreachable, 1-reachable.

parameter.name: PDSNIPAddress
parameter.description: IP address of the PDSN.

parameter.name: A11RegUpdateInterPDSNHandoffPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 Reg-Update messages received from a PDSN with reason code "Inter PDSN Handoff"

parameter.name: A11RegUpdatePDSNOAMPInterventionPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 Reg-Update messages received from a PDSN with reason code "PDSN OAMP Intervention"

parameter.name: A11RegUpdateAccountingErrorPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 Reg-Update messages received from a PDSN with reason code "Accounting Error"

parameter.name: A11RegUpdateUserFailedAuthenticationPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 Reg-Update messages received from a PDSN with reason code "User Failed Authentication"

parameter.name: A11RegUpdateUnknownCauseCodePDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 Reg-Update messages received from a PDSN with Unknown Cause Code

parameter.name: A11RegUpdateWithoutReasonCodePDSN
parameter.description: Number of A10 Reg-Update messages received from a PDSN with PDSN Code Not Included

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.PCFPDSN.{i}.AuxA10Stats.

parameter.name: PDSNNumberAuxA10Perf

parameter.name: PDSNIPAddressAuxA10Perf
parameter.description: The IP Address of the PDSN for which the PCF PDSN stats is obtained

parameter.name: AuxA10ConnectionsCreatedInFirstRegReqPDSN

parameter.name: AuxA10ConnectionsCreatedInSubsequentRegReqPDSN
parameter.description: Number of Auxillary A10 Connections Created in Subsequent Registration Request Messages to the PDSN

parameter.name: AuxA10FwdIpFlowsCreatedPDSN

parameter.name: AuxA10RevIpFlowsCreatedPDSN

parameter.name: AuxA10IpFlowAccountingRegRequestsPDSN

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.PCFPDSN.{i}.PCFPDSNStats.

parameter.name: A10SetupAttemptsPDSN
parameter.description: Number of attempts the PCF made to establish an A10 connection with PDSN. If PCF fails establishing such a connection on this PDSN and goes on to use another PDSN for that connection, it will be counted as two setup attempts.

parameter.name: A10SetupSuccessesPDSN
parameter.description: Number of times PCF succeeded in establishing an A10 connection with this PDSN.

parameter.name: A10SetupBlocksPDSN
parameter.description: Number of times PCF was blocked in establishing an A10 connection with this PDSN.

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedIdMismatchPDSN

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedUnknownPDSNPDSN

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedNoReasonPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A11 Registration Request denied with no reason code by the PDSN.

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedAdminProhibitPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A11 Registration Request denied with a reason "Admin Prohibited" (A11 error code : 0x81) by the PDSN.

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedInsuffResourcesPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A11 Registration Request denied with a reason "Insufficient Resources" (A11 error code: 0x82) by the PDSN.

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedFailedAuthPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A11 Registration Request denied with a reason "Mobile Node Authentication Failure" (A11 error code: 0x83) by the PDSN.

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedMalformedReqPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A11 Registration Request denied with a reason "Malformed Request" (A11 error code: 0x86) by the PDSN

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedUnsuppVendIdPDSN
parameter.description: Number ofA11 Registration Request denied with a reason "Unsupported Vendor Id" (A11 error code: 0x8D)by the PDSN

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedReverseTunnelUnavailablePDSN
parameter.description: Number ofA11 Registration Request denied with a reason "Reverse Tunnel Unavailable" (A11 error code: 0x89)by the PDSN

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedReverseTunnelTbitNotSetPDSN
parameter.description: Number ofA11 Registration Request denied with a reason "Reverse Tunnel Tbit Not Set" (A11 error code: 0x8A)by the PDSN

parameter.name: A11RegReqDeniedUnknownErrorCodePDSN
parameter.description: Number of A11 Registration Request denied with an unspecified reason (A11 error code : 0x80) by the PDSN

parameter.name: A10RegReqForRegistrationRetransmissionsPDSN

parameter.name: A10RegReqForReRegistrationRetransmissionsPDSN
parameter.description: Number of A11 Registration Requests retransmitted during A10 reregistration

parameter.name: A10RegReqForReleaseRetransmissionsPDSN

parameter.name: PDSNNumberPDSNPerf

parameter.name: PDSNipAddressPDSNPerf
