object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.Redirect.
object.description: CDMA2000 HRPD service redirection parameters.

parameter.name: RedirectChannelNumber
parameter.description: The channel number set from ACS that the FAP uses to redirect the AT in case of closed access or when exceeding session capacity. The ACS shall push this if the the operator has provided this information in a configuration file. If this is not configured, the FAP rejects the AT. The supported range is 0..2047.

parameter.name: RedirectBandClass
parameter.description: The bandclass set from ACS that the FAP uses to redirect the AT incase of closed access or when exceeding session capacity. The ACS shall push this if the the operator has provided this information in a configuration file. If this is not configured, the FAP rejects the AT. The supported range is 0..9.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.CallControlStats.
object.description: Details on call control stats

parameter.name: NumSessionSetupAttempts
parameter.description: This parameter is a counter for the total number of session instances that are created on a specific FAP when a regular session setup attempt is initiated with an unknown RATI

parameter.name: NumSessionSetupSuccessful
parameter.description: This parameter is a counter for the total number of successful regular session setup attempts that are initiated with an unknown RATI

parameter.name: NumCurrentSessionsEstablished
parameter.description: This parameter is a counter for the total number of successfully established HRPD Sessions that exists on a specific picasso

parameter.name: NumPageMessagesToAt
parameter.description: The number of times a Page Message was sent to the AT to facilitate the setup of a connection.

parameter.name: NumPagesSucceeded
parameter.description: The total number of pages succeeded

parameter.name: NumConnectionsOpened
parameter.description: Total HRPD Connections Opened

parameter.name: NumSessionSetupsFailedToTermAuth
parameter.description: This parameter is a counter for the total number of HRPD session setups that are aborted due to various failure reasons

parameter.name: NumForwardRLPBytes
parameter.description: Number of HRPD packets(bytes) sent from PDSN to AT.

parameter.name: NumReverseRLPBytes
parameter.description: No. of HRPD packets(bytes) sent from AT to PDSN.

parameter.name: AverageSessionSetupTime
parameter.description: This parameter maintains a record of the average session setup time for all successfully setup sessions on a specific FAP. The average session setup time is in units of {{units}}.

parameter.name: AveragePageSetupTime
parameter.description: The average connection setup time in response to a FAP initiated page. The time is from initiation of Page to the time the connection is declared open

parameter.name: NumConnSetupsAborted
parameter.description: The number of connection setups that were aborted

parameter.name: NumForwardPreRLPDroppedPkts
parameter.description: Number of packets dropped at Pre-RLP queue due to overflow in forward direction. This counter will also be written to the performance log.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.QoSStats.
object.description: This object is used in obtaining the QoS Common Performance stats

parameter.name: NumQoSSubscriberProfileUpdatesRcvd
parameter.description: Number of subscriber QoS profile updates received from the PDSN.

parameter.name: NumPDSNIPFlowUpdatesMsgRcvd
parameter.description: Number of PDSN IP flow update messages received from PDSN.

parameter.name: NumPDSNIPFlowUpdatesMsgFailed
parameter.description: Number of PDSN IP Flow updates messages that failed per RNC.

parameter.name: NumQoSSetupRequestsReceived
parameter.description: Number of QoS setup requests received from the AT.

parameter.name: NumQoSSetupRequestsAccepted
parameter.description: Number of QoS setup requests received from the AT that the FAP RNC accepted.

parameter.name: NumQoSSetupRequestsRejected
parameter.description: Number of QoS setup requests from the AT that the FAP RNC rejected.

parameter.name: NumReservationOnRequestsReceived
parameter.description: Number of ReservationOnRequest messages received from the AT.

parameter.name: NumReservationOnRequestsAccepted
parameter.description: Number of ReservationOnRequest messages received from the AT that the FAP RNC accepted.

parameter.name: NumReservationOnRequestsRejected
parameter.description: Number of ReservationOnRequest message received from the AT that the FAP RNC rejected.

parameter.name: NumReservationOnRequestsFailed
parameter.description: Number of ReservationOnRequest message received from the AT that the FAP RNC failed.

parameter.name: NumFwdReservationOnMessagesSent
parameter.description: Number of times the FAP RNC sent a FwdReservationOn message to the AT to activate a forward Reservation.

parameter.name: NumRevReservationOnMessagesSent
parameter.description: Number of times the FAP RNC sent a RevReservationOn message to the AT to activate a reverse Reservation.

parameter.name: NumReservationOffRequestsReceived
parameter.description: Number of ReservationOffRequest message is received from the AT.

parameter.name: NumReservationOffRequestsAccepted
parameter.description: Number of ReservationOffRequest messages received from the AT that the FAP RNC accepted.

parameter.name: NumReservationOffRequestsRejected
parameter.description: Number of ReservationOffRequest messages received from the AT that the FAP RNC rejected.

parameter.name: NumFwdReservationOffMessagesSent
parameter.description: Number of times the FAP RNC sent a FwdReservationOff message to the AT to deactivate a forward Reservation.

parameter.name: NumRevReservationOffMessagesSent
parameter.description: Number of times the FAP RNC sent a RevReservationOff message to the AT to deactivate a reverse Reservation.

parameter.name: NumQoSReleaseRequestsReceived
parameter.description: Number of QoS release requests received from the AT.

parameter.name: NumConnectionCloseInitiatedNoRANRsr
parameter.description: Number of times FAP RNC initiated a connection close in response to the ReservationOnRequest because it did not have the RAN resources to satisfy one or more Reservations included in the request.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.RNCSigAppsStats.
object.description: Stats for HRPD RNC signaling procedures.

parameter.name: CNumPageRequests
parameter.description: Number of HRPD Page requests made after data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: SNumPageRequests
parameter.description: Number of HRPD Page requests made before data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: SNumConnectionSetupAttempts
parameter.description: Number of HRPD Connection setups attempted before data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: CNumConnectionSetupAttempts
parameter.description: Number of HRPD Connection setups attempted after data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: SNumConnectionSetupSuccess
parameter.description: Number of HRPD Connection setups succeeded before data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: CNumConnectionSetupSuccess
parameter.description: Number of HRPD Connection setups succeeded after data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: SNumNormalConnectionCloses
parameter.description: The number of HRPD connections that were closed normally before data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: CNumNormalConnectionCloses
parameter.description: The number of HRPD connections that were closed normally after data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: SNumTotalConnectionCloses
parameter.description: The total number of HRPD connections closed, normally or abnormally, data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: CNumTotalConnectionCloses
parameter.description: The total number of HRPD connections closed, normally or abnormally, after data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: SNumRFRelatedDrops
parameter.description: Number of HRPD connection close because of RTC loss or No FTC before data has flowed on the A10 connection

parameter.name: CNumRFRelatedDrops
parameter.description: Number of HRPD connection close because of RTC loss or No FTC after data has flowed on the A10 connection

parameter.name: SNumPageResponses
parameter.description: Total number of successful responses to HRPD page requests that were received from the AT before the final page timeout and before data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: CNumPageResponses
parameter.description: Total number of successful responses to HRPD page requests that were received from the AT before the final page timeout and after data has flowed on the A10 connection.

parameter.name: SNumRFRelatedDropsRTCLost
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of times the HRPD connection was dropped before data has flowed on the A10 connection because a Reverse Traffic Channel (RTC) lost indication was received, and as a result, no reverse link for the connection were available.

parameter.name: CNumRFRelatedDropsRTCLost
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of times the HRPD connection was dropped after data has flowed on the A10 connection because a Reverse Traffic Channel (RTC) lost indication was received, and as a result, no reverse link for the connection were available.

parameter.name: SNumRFRelatedDropsNoFTC
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were dropped before data has flowed on the A10 connection because of indications that there is no active Forward Traffic Channel (FTC) available.

parameter.name: CNumRFRelatedDropsNoFTC
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were dropped after data has flowed on the A10 connection because of indications that there is no active Forward Traffic Channel (FTC) available.

parameter.name: SNumNetworkErrorDrops
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were closed before data has flowed on the A10 connection because the FAP closed the open A10 connection.

parameter.name: CNumNetworkErrorDrops
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were closed after data has flowed on the A10 connection because the FAP closed the open A10 connection.

parameter.name: SNumNetworkErrorDropsRNCInternal
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of open HRPD connections that were closed before data has flowed on the A10 connection because the FAP closed the A10 connection due to internal failures.

parameter.name: CNumNetworkErrorDropsRNCInternal
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of open HRPD connections that were closed after data has flowed on the A10 connection because the FAP closed the A10 connection due to internal failures.

parameter.name: SNumNetworkErrorDropsRNCExternal
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of open HRPD connections that were closed before data has flowed on the A10 connection because the FAP closed the A10 connection due to the PDSN unreachablity.

parameter.name: CNumNetworkErrorDropsRNCExternal
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of open HRPD connections that were closed after data has flowed on the A10 connection because the FAP closed the A10 connection due to the PDSN unreachablity.

parameter.name: SNumNetworkErrorDropsA10SetupFail
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of open HRPD connections that were closed before data has flowed on the A10 connection because there was failure in the A10 connection set-up.

parameter.name: CNumNetworkErrorDropsA10SetupFail
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of open HRPD connections that were closed after data has flowed on the A10 connection because there was failure in the A10 connection set-up.

parameter.name: SNumMiscDropsSectorDown
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were dropped before data has flowed on the A10 connection because there is only one pilot available for the connection and a sector down indication has been received for that pilot.

parameter.name: CNumMiscDropsSectorDown
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were dropped after data has flowed on the A10 connection because there is only one pilot available for the connection and a sector down indication has been received for that pilot.

parameter.name: SNumMiscDropsInternalError
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were dropped before data has flowed on the A10 connection due to internal software errors.

parameter.name: CNumMiscDropsInternalError
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were dropped after data has flowed on the A10 connection due to internal software errors.

parameter.name: CNumMiscDropsStateMismatch
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of HRPD connections that were dropped after data has flowed on the A10 connection when the FAP finds a state mismatch between itself andthe AT. Such a mismatch is found when a connection request message is received from the AT, and the connection is already open as perceived by the FAP.

parameter.name: SNumMiscDropsStateMismatch
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of connections that were dropped before the demarcation point when the FAP finds a state mismatch between itself and the AT. Such a mismatch is found when a connection request message is received from the AT, and the connection is already open as perceived by the FAP.

parameter.name: SNumMiscDropsDueToRLP
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of times the HRPD connection was dropped before data has flowed on the A10 connection at the request of the Radio Link Protocol. This request is generated when the HDR Fast Path component finds that the reset acknowledgment timeout has expired for the connection.

parameter.name: CNumMiscDropsDueToRLP
parameter.description: This statistic counts the number of times the HRPD connection was dropped after data has flowed on the A10 connection at the request of the Radio Link Protocol. This request is generated when the HDR Fast Path component finds that the reset acknowledgment timeout has expired for the connection.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.AccessAuthConfig.
object.description: HRPD A12-related service stats.

parameter.name: A12AccessAuthenticationEnable
parameter.description: Flag to enable/Disable HRPD Access Authentication. {{true}} - Enabled, {{false}} - Disabled.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.HRPD.AccessAuthStats.
object.description: This object is used in obtaining the Access Authentication related stats.

parameter.name: AnPppAuthenticationAttemptsByNode
parameter.description: Number of AnPppAuthentications attempted by the FAP.

parameter.name: A12RequestsSentFromNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 Access Requests Sent from the FAP.

parameter.name: A12RejectsReceivedByNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 Access Rejects received from the FAP.

parameter.name: A12AcceptsReceivedByNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 Access Accepts received by the FAP.

parameter.name: A12AccessChallengesReceivedByNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 Access Challenges received by the FAP.

parameter.name: A12RetransmitsSentFromNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 Access Requests retransmitted from the FAP.

parameter.name: A12TimeoutsEventsForNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 Timeout events occurred at the FAP due to unreachability of the AAA server/ no response from the AAA server.

parameter.name: A12MalformedresponseReceivedByNode
parameter.description: Number of Malformed A12 Access Response received by the FAP RNC.

parameter.name: A12BadAuthenticatorReceivedByNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 Access Response with Bad Authenticator received by the FAP RNC.

parameter.name: A12UnknownTypeReceivedByNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 Packet of unknown type received by the FAP RNC.

parameter.name: A12UnknownPktReceivedByNode
parameter.description: Number of unknown A12 packets received by the FAP RNC.

parameter.name: A12UnknownServerReceivedByNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 packets received from unknown AAA server by the FAP RNC.

parameter.name: A12OtherFailureOccurencesInNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 packets failed due to other failure occurences in the AAA server.

parameter.name: A12ByPassNumAtsWithUnknownMfrCodeByNode
parameter.description: Number of ATs with UnknowMfrCode detected in the FAP RNC.

parameter.name: A12TxPathFailDueToAnPppErrorByNode
parameter.description: Number of times sending of A12 packet failed in Tx Path in the FAP RNC due to "AnPPP Error".

parameter.name: A12TxPathFailDueToNoServerAvailableByNode
parameter.description: Number of times sending of A12 packet failed in Tx Path in the FAP RNC due to "No Server Available".

parameter.name: A12TxPathFailDueToInternalErrorByNode
parameter.description: Number of times sending of A12 packet failed in Tx Path in the FAP RNC due to "internal error".

parameter.name: A12TxPathFailDueToNoPacketIdAvailableByNode
parameter.description: Number of times sending of A12 packet failed in Tx Path in the FAP RNC due to "No packet id available".

parameter.name: A12TxPathFailDueToTransmitErrorByNode
parameter.description: Number of times sending of A12 packet failed in Tx Path in the FAP RNC due to "Transmit Error".

parameter.name: A12SvrTimeoutsForNode
parameter.description: Number of A12 server timeouts happened in the FAP RNC.

parameter.name: A12EnhTaBypassLcpTimeoutByNode
parameter.description: Number of LCP timeouts happened in the FAP RNC when Enhanced TA A12Bypass mode is enabled.

parameter.name: A12EnhTaBypassChapTimeoutByNode
parameter.description: Number of CHAP timeouts happened in the FAP RNC when Enhanced TA A12Bypass mode is enabled.

parameter.name: A12EnhTaBypassChapInvalidByNode
parameter.description: Number of CHAP Challenge response received from the AT when Enhanced TA A12Bypass mode is enabled.

parameter.name: A12EnhTaBypassChapNaiMatchesA12BypassListByNode
parameter.description: Number of times the CHAP NAI received from the AT matches with A12Bypass List in the FAP RNC when Enhanced TA A12Bypass mode is enabled.

parameter.name: A12SessionTaTimeoutByNode
parameter.description: Number of times Session timeouts occurred due to TA.

parameter.name: AccessAuthFailedDueToSessionCloseTotal
parameter.description: Number of times the Access Authenticaiton failed due to Sesion close.

parameter.name: AccessAuthSucceeded
parameter.description: Number of times the Access Authenticaiton succeeded.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.Beacon.
object.description: This object models the attributes to control the generalized beacon. The beacon is modeled as a beacon frame composed of multiple beacon intervals. The beacon frame start is time-aligned to the instant when 1x 80ms paging frames and HRPD control channel frames align (occurs once every 1.28s).

parameter.name: BeaconAdminStatus
parameter.description: Allows administrative control of beacon.

parameter.name: BeaconOperStatus
parameter.description: Reports operational status of beacon.

parameter.name: HRPDBeaconEnable
parameter.description: If set to {{true}} the HRPD-specific beacon described by {{object|HRPDBeaconList}} object is enabled. If set to {{false}}, all HRPD beacons (if any) are contained in the BeaconList object.

parameter.name: Period
parameter.description: Length and periodicity of the beacon frame in {{units}}. Reference - {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: MaxFAPBeaconTxPower
parameter.description:
Maximum transmission power allowed on the FAP Beacon frequencies. {{param}} is expressed as a range of allowed maximum power levels with ".." (two periods)
between the upper and lower values, i.e. "<;Pmax_low>..<;Pmax_high>".
{{param}} identifies the limits between which the FAP can self-configure its maximum beacon transmit power.
Self-configuration for maximum beacon transmission power is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.MaxFAPBeaconTxPowerConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.MaxFAPBeaconTxPowerSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. <;Pmax_low> and <;Pmax_high> are measured in dBm and have a range of -40.0 to 20.0 incremented by 0.1 dB.

parameter.name: MaxFAPBeaconTxPowerInUse
parameter.description: Maximum beacon transmission power measured in {{units}} currently used by the FAP on any beacon frequency. Actual values of the maximum transmission power are -40.0 dBm to 20.0 dBm in steps of 0.1 dB. The value of {{param}} divided by 10 yields the actual value of the maximum transmission power.

parameter.name: BeaconPchPwrPercentage
parameter.description:
Percentage of Max Sector Power Used By Paging Channel (expressed in {{units}}).
For example, 93333 means 93.333% of the max sector power.

parameter.name: MaxHRPDBeaconTxPower
parameter.description:
Maximum transmission power allowed on the dedicated HRPD beacon. {{param}} is expressed as a range of allowed maximum power levels with ".." (two periods) between the upper and lower values, i.e. "<Pmax_low>..<Pmax_high>".
MaxHRPDBeaconTxPower identifies the limits between which the FAP can self-configure its maximum beacon transmit power. Self-configuration for maximum beacon transmission power is controlled by {{param|.Capabilities.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.MaxFAPBeaconTxPowerConfig}} from an availability perspective and {{param|.FAPControl.CDMA2000.OneX.SelfConfig.MaxFAPBeaconTxPowerSelfConfigEnable}} from an enabled perspective. <Pmax_low> and <Pmax_high> are measured in dBm and have a range of -40.0 to 20.0 incremented by 0.1 dB.

parameter.name: MaxHRPDBeaconTxPowerInUse
parameter.description:
Maximum beacon transmission power measured in dBm currently used by the FAP on any beacon frequency.
Actual values of the maximum transmission power are -40.0 dBm to 20.0 in units of {{units}}. The value of {{param}} divided by 10 yields the actual value of the maximum transmission power.

parameter.name: BeaconPilotPwrPercentage
parameter.description: Percentage of Max Sector Power Used By Pilot Channel (expressed in {{units}}). For example, 19950 means 19.950% of total.

parameter.name: BeaconSyncPwrPercentage
parameter.description: Percentage of Max Sector Power Used By Sync Channel (expressed in {{units}}). For example, 23458 means 23.458% of the max sector power.

parameter.name: MaxBeaconListEntries
parameter.description: Maximum number of entries in the {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.Beacon.BeaconList.{i}.}} object.

parameter.name: BeaconListNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MaxHRPDBeaconListEntries
parameter.description: Maximum number of entries in the {{object|.CellConfig.CDMA2000.Beacon.HRPDBeaconList.{i}.}} object.

parameter.name: HRPDBeaconListNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.Beacon.BeaconList.{i}.
object.description: This object models an individual beacon intervals. It may be used to model both 1x and HRPD beacons with offset from start of beacon frame measured in 80ms slots.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: BeaconIndex
parameter.description: Instance identifier for this beacon interval. Allowed range is 0..(BeaconListNumberOfEntries-1).

parameter.name: Offset
parameter.description: Offset from the start of the beacon frame in 80ms slots.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: Duration of this beacon interval in {{units}}.

parameter.name: TransmissionFormat
parameter.description: Determines if this beacon interval shall transmit HRPD (HRPD) or CDMA2000 1x.{HRPD="0", 1x="1"}.

parameter.name: BeaconBandClass
parameter.description: Band class for this beacon interval.

parameter.name: BeaconChannelFreq
parameter.description: Channel number for this beacon interval.

parameter.name: BeaconPNOffset
parameter.description: {{list}} Each item is a pilot PN offset of the pilot beacon for this channel in units of 64 PN chips. If this parameter contains more than one item, then the FAP is expected to select one from the list as the PilotPN to be used for this channel. If the self-configuration capability is not to be used, then this parameter SHALL contain only a single item.

parameter.name: TxPower
parameter.description: TX power for the beacon interval (in {{units}}). If self-configuration of the Beacon Tx Power is enabled, then this value is determined by the FAP.

parameter.name: BeaconSID
parameter.description: SID for this beacon interval.

parameter.name: BeaconNID
parameter.description: NID for this beacon interval.

parameter.name: BeaconPZID
parameter.description: PZID for this beacon interval.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.CellConfig.CDMA2000.Beacon.HRPDBeaconList.{i}.
object.description: This object models individual HRPD beacon intervals where the beacon start is expressed as a number of HRPD control channel slots from the start of the beacon frame.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: BeaconIndex
parameter.description: Instance identifier for this beacon interval. Allowed range is 0..(HRPDBeaconListNumberOfEntries-1).

parameter.name: CCoffset
parameter.description: Offset of the current beacon interval from the start of the beacon frame, in Control Channel cycles. The HRPDBeaconList interval SHOULD not overlap in time with any beacon interval for the same channel defined in the BeaconList object.

parameter.name: Offset
parameter.description: Start of beacon transmission with respect to the Control Channel boundary.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: Duration of the beacon transmission within a Control Channel cycle, in slots. Beacon is transmitted starting offset from the CC boundary for duration. Transmission restarts offset from the next CC boundary, given that beacon interval spans more than 1 CC cycles.

parameter.name: NumCCcycles
parameter.description: Number of Control Channel Cycles this beacon interval spans.

parameter.name: BeaconBandClass
parameter.description: Band class for this beacon interval.

parameter.name: BeaconChannelFreq
parameter.description: Channel number for this beacon interval.

parameter.name: BeaconPNOffset
parameter.description: {{list}} Each item is a pilot PN offset of the pilot beacon for this channel in units of 64 PN chips. If this parameter contains more than one item, then the FAP is expected to select one from the list as the PilotPN to be used for this channel. If the self-configuration capability is not to be used, then this parameter SHALL contain only a single item.

parameter.name: TxPower
parameter.description: TX power for the beacon interval. If self-configuration of the HRPD Beacon Tx Power is enabled, then this value is determined by the FAP.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to REM (Radio Environment Measurement).

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.
object.description: This object contains Radio Environment Measurement parameters for UMTS FAP.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.WCDMA.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to radio environment measurement capabilities for the UMTS system.

parameter.name: InServiceHandling
parameter.description: FAP REM behavior with respect to ongoing active connections.

enumeration.description: Immediately perform REM, even if have active connections or idle camping UE that MAY be disrupted.
Wait to initiate REM until no CS bearers or PS bearers of streaming or higher QoS class are assigned.

parameter.name: ScanOnBoot
parameter.description: Enables or disables Radio Environment Measurement during the FAP start up.

parameter.name: ScanPeriodically
parameter.description: Enable Periodic Radio Environment Measurement on all enabled RAT.

parameter.name: PeriodicInterval
parameter.description: When {{param|ScanPeriodically}} is {{true}}, this value indicates the interval in {{units}} which REM is performed while the FAP service is enabled.

parameter.name: PeriodicTime
parameter.description:
An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE will initiate the periodic REM. Each REM MUST occur at (or as soon as possible after) this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|PeriodicInterval}}.
{{param}} is used only to set the "phase" of the REM. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future.
For example, if {{param|PeriodicInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then periodic REMs will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future.
The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|Section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE MAY locally choose the time reference, and needs only to adhere to the specified PeriodicInformInterval.
If absolute time is not available to the CPE, its periodic REM behavior MUST be the same as if {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: REMPLMNList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a PLMN ID to measure. PLMN ID consists of Mobile Country Code (MCC) and Mobile Network Code (MNC) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}, {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.008}}.
If {{empty}}, then no specific PLMN ID is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to scan all available PLMN IDs.

parameter.name: REMBandList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a UMTS Band to measure. Each band is identified in by a roman numeral {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.104}}.
If {{empty}} then no specific UMTS band is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to scan all available bands.
The order of the band indicator has no significance.

parameter.name: UARFCNDLList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each entry is a UARFCN in the DL direction to measure.
If {{empty}}, then no specific UARFCN is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to scan all UARFCNs that it is aware of.

parameter.name: ScanTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the time-out value in {{units}}, measured from the start of the REM scan, before the REM scan will time out.

parameter.name: ScanStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the current status of this scan.

enumeration.description: The scan has not been executed and there are no valid scan results available

parameter.name: ErrorDetails
parameter.description: Provides more detail when the {{param|ScanStatus}} is either {{enum|Error|ScanStatus}} or {{enum|Error_TIMEOUT|ScanStatus}}.

parameter.name: LastScanTime
parameter.description: The time of the last UMTS system radio environment measurement.

parameter.name: MaxCellEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|.REM.UMTS.WCDMA.Cell.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: CellNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.WCDMA.Cell.{i}.
object.description: Table indicating the components of the discovered cells.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.WCDMA.Cell.{i}.RF.
object.description: Table indicating the RF aspect of the discovered cells.

parameter.name: UARFCNDL
parameter.description: The UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number (UARFCN) in the DL direction of an FDD mode cell. {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.433}}

parameter.name: CPICHRSCP
parameter.description: Received signal level in {{units}} of the CPICH channel. (Ref. 3GPP TS 25.133)

parameter.name: CPICHEcNo
parameter.description:
Measured EcNo. (energy per chip to interference power density) in {{units}} received in the downlink pilot channel.
Actual values of the range are -24.0 {{units}} to 0.0 {{units}} in steps of 0.5 {{units}}. The value of {{param}} divided by 2 yields the actual value of the range. {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.133|Section 9.1.2.3}}

parameter.name: RSSI
PrimaryScramblingCode
parameter.description: Primary scrambling code.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.WCDMA.Cell.{i}.BCCH.
object.description: Table containing the system information broadcast in the BCCH logical channel.

parameter.name: PLMNType
parameter.description: Type of Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN).

parameter.name: PLMNID
parameter.description:
PLMN ID consists of Mobile Country Code (MCC) and Mobile Network Code (MNC) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}, {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.008}}.
Mobile Country Code consists of three digits and uniquely identifies the country of domicile of the subscriber.
Mobile Network Code consists of two or three digits and identifies the Home PLMN within a country.
For a 2-digit MNC the total string length of {{param}} is 5.

parameter.name: LAC
parameter.description: Location Area Code (LAC) as defined in SIB 1 {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331}}. The concatenation of PLMN ID (MCC+MNC) and LAC uniquely identifies the LAI (Location Area ID) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}.

parameter.name: RAC
parameter.description: Routing Area Code (RAC) as defined in SIB 1 {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331}}. The concatenation of PLMN ID (MCC+MNC), LAC, and RAC uniquely identifies the RAI (Routing Area ID) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}.

parameter.name: CellID
parameter.description: Cell Identity as defined in SIB3 {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section10.3.2.2}}. {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.008}}

parameter.name: PCPICHTxPower
parameter.description: Primary Common Pilot Channel (CPICH) power level on SIB 5/6 {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section10.3.6.55}}.

parameter.name: CSGIndicator
parameter.description:
The CSG-indicator Information Element (IE) in the Master Information Block reflects the access mode of the CSG cell. It is hence dependent on the value of {{param|.AccessMgmt.UMTS.AccessMode}}.
If {{true}} the CSG-indicator IE is present, reflecting closed access to the CSG cell.
If {{false}} the CSG-indicator IE is absent, reflecting the access mode as "not a closed-access".
{{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section 10.2.48.8.1}}

parameter.name: CSGID
parameter.description: Defines the Closed Subscriber Group of the Access Control List. FAP broadcasts this CSG ID in SIB3 {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section10.3.2.8}} depending on the AccessMode.

parameter.name: UARFCNDLList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number (UARFCN} in the DL direction dedicated to the CSG cells.
{{param}} is broadcast in SIB 11bis {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section 10.2.48.8.14a}}.
The corresponding UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number (UARFCN} in the UL direction is derived based on the fixed offset applicable for the frequency band.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.WCDMA.Cell.{i}.BCCH.CSGPSCSplitInfo.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to the Primary Scambling Code (PSC) split information for the CSG. Defined in SIB3/11bis {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section 10.3.2.8 and 10.3.2.9}}.

parameter.name: StartPSCRange1Coefficient
parameter.description: The value of this Information Element (IE) multiplied by 8 specifies the start PSC value of the first PSC range as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section 8.6.2.4}}.

parameter.name: NumberOfPSCs
parameter.description: This Information Element (IE) specifies the number of PSCs reserved for CSG cells in each PSC range.

parameter.name: PSCRange2Offset
parameter.description:
If this Information Element (IE) is included, the UE shall calculate the second PSC range as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section 8.6.2.4}}.
If this Information Element (IE) is not included, the UE shall consider the second PSC range to be not present.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.WCDMA.Cell.{i}.BCCH.ReferencePosition.

parameter.name: Latitude
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the latitude of the device's position in degrees, multiplied by 1 million. The positive value signifies the direction, north of the equator. The negative value signifies the direction, south of the equator.
Range is from: 90.00.00' South (-90,000,000) to 90.00.00' North (90,000,000).
Example: A latitude of 13.19.43' N would be represented as 13,323,833, derived as (13*1,000,000)+((19.43*1,000,000)/60). Latitude of 50.00.00' S would be represented as value -50,000,000.
If 0 then SIB15 is not detected in the specific cell.

parameter.name: Longitude
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the longitude of the device's position in degrees, multiplied by 1 million. The positive value signifies the direction, east of the prime meridian. The negative value signifies the direction, west of the prime meridian.
Range is from: 180.00.00' West (-180,000,000) to 180.00.00' East (180,000,000).
Example: A longitude of 13.19.43' E would be represented as 13,323,833, derived as (13*1,000,000)+((19.43*1,000,000)/60). A longitude of 50.00'0'' W would be represented as value -50,000,000.
If 0 then SIB15 is not detected in the specific cell.

parameter.name: UncertaintySemiMajor
UncertaintySemiMinor
OrientationOfMajorAxis
parameter.description:
The Information Element (IE) value 'N' is derived by this formula:
2N <= a < 2(N+1)
Where 'a' is the orientation in degrees (0..179).

parameter.name: Confidence
parameter.description: The degree of confidence in the ellipsoid's points expressed in {{units}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.GSM.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to GSM REM capabilities.

parameter.name: InServiceHandling
parameter.description: FAP REM behavior with respect to ongoing active connections.

enumeration.description: Immediately perform REM, even if have active connections or idle camping UE that MAY be disrupted.
Wait to initiate REM until no CS bearers or PS bearers of streaming or higher QoS class are assigned.

parameter.name: ScanOnBoot
parameter.description: Enables or disables Radio Environment Measurement during the FAP start up.

parameter.name: ScanPeriodically
parameter.description: Enable Periodic Radio Environment Measurement on all enabled RAT.

parameter.name: PeriodicInterval
parameter.description: When {{param|ScanPeriodically}} is {{true}}, this value indicates the interval in {{units}} which REM is performed while the FAP service is enabled.

parameter.name: PeriodicTime
parameter.description:
An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE will initiate the periodic REM. Each REM MUST occur at (or as soon as possible after) this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|PeriodicInterval}}.
{{param}} is used only to set the "phase" of the REM. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future.
For example, if {{param|PeriodicInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then periodic REMs will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future.
The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|Section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE MAY locally choose the time reference, and needs only to adhere to the specified PeriodicInformInterval.
If absolute time is not available to the CPE, its periodic REM behavior MUST be the same as if {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: REMPLMNList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a PLMNID.
PLMN ID consists of Mobile Country Code (MCC) and Mobile Network Code (MNC) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}, {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.008}}.
Mobile Country Code consists of three digits and uniquely identifies the country of domicile of the subscriber.
Mobile Network Code consists of two or three digits and identifies the Home PLMN within a country.
For a 2-digit MNC the total string length of the PLMNID is 5.
If {{empty}} no specific PLMN ID is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to report all available PLMN IDs.
If a list is provided, the FAP is expected to limit the REM measurement to the PLMN(s) specified in this list only and ignore others even if they are detected.

parameter.name: REMBandList
ARFCNList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a GSM ARFCN to measure.
If {{empty}} then no specific ARFCN is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to scan all ARFCNs.
If a list is provided, the FAP is expected to limit the REM measurement to the ARFCN(s) specified in this list only and ignore others even if they are detected.

parameter.name: ScanTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the time-out value in {{units}}, measured from the start of the REM scan, before the REM scan will time out.

parameter.name: ScanStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the current status of this scan.

enumeration.description: The scan has not been executed and there are no valid scan results available

parameter.name: ErrorDetails
parameter.description: Provides more detail when the {{param|ScanStatus}} is either {{enum|Error|ScanStatus}} or {{enum|Error_TIMEOUT|ScanStatus}}.

parameter.name: LastScanTime
parameter.description: The time of the last GSM radio environment measurement.

parameter.name: MaxCellEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries allowed in the {{object|.REM.UMTS.GSM.Cell.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: CellNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.UMTS.GSM.Cell.{i}.
object.description: Table indicating the components of the discovered cells.

parameter.name: BandIndicator
parameter.description: Indicates how to interpret the BCCH ARFCN.

parameter.name: ARFCN
parameter.description: Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number (ARFCN) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.05.05}}.

parameter.name: BSIC
parameter.description: Base Station Identity Code {{bibref|3GPP-TS.03.03}}.

parameter.name: PLMNID
parameter.description:
PLMN ID consists of Mobile Country Code (MCC) and Mobile Network Code (MNC) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}, {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.008}}.
Mobile Country Code consists of three digits and uniquely identifies the country of domicile of the subscriber.
Mobile Network Code consists of two or three digits and identifies the Home PLMN within a country.
For a 2-digit MNC the total string length of the PLMNID is 5.

parameter.name: LAC
parameter.description: Location Area Code (LAC) as defined in SIB1 {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331}}. The concatenation of PLMN ID (MCC+MNC) and LAC uniquely identifies the LAI (Location Area ID) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}.

parameter.name: RAC
CI
parameter.description: Cell Identity. {{bibref|3GPP-TS.25.331|Section 10.3.2.2}}

parameter.name: RSSI
parameter.description: Received signal level in {{units}} of the BCCH carrier.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.LTE.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to radio environment measurement capabilities for the LTE system.

parameter.name: InServiceHandling
parameter.description: FAP REM behavior with respect to ongoing active connections.

enumeration.description: Immediately perform REM, even if have active connections or idle camping UE that MAY be disrupted.
Wait to initiate REM until no CS bearers or PS bearers of streaming or higher QoS class are assigned.

parameter.name: ScanOnBoot
parameter.description: Enables or disables Radio Environment Measurement during the FAP start up.

parameter.name: ScanPeriodically
parameter.description: Enable Periodic Radio Environment Measurement on LTE EUTRAN bands.

parameter.name: PeriodicInterval
parameter.description: When {{param|ScanPeriodically}} is {{true}}, this value indicates the interval in {{units}} which REM is performed while the FAP service is enabled.

parameter.name: PeriodicTime
parameter.description:
An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE will initiate the periodic REM. Each REM MUST occur at (or as soon as possible after) this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|PeriodicInterval}}.
{{param}} is used only to set the "phase" of the REM. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future.
For example, if {{param|PeriodicInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then periodic REMs will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future.
The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|Section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE MAY locally choose the time reference, and needs only to adhere to the specified PeriodicInformInterval.
If absolute time is not available to the CPE, its periodic REM behavior MUST be the same as if {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: REMPLMNList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a PLMN ID to measure. PLMN ID consists of Mobile Country Code (MCC) and Mobile Network Code (MNC) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}, {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.008}}.
If {{empty}}, then no specific PLMN ID is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to scan all available PLMN IDs.

parameter.name: REMBandList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a LTE Band to measure. Corresponds to frequency band indicator defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.101|Table 5.5-1}}.
If {{empty}} then no specific LTE band is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to scan all available bands.
The order of the band indicator has no significance.

parameter.name: EUTRACarrierARFCNDLList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each entry is a EUTRA ARFCN in the DL direction to measure. Corrsponds to the parameter NDL in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.101|Section 5.7.3}}.
If {{empty}}, then no specific EUTRA ARFCN is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to scan all ARFCNs that it is aware of.

parameter.name: ScanTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the time-out value in {{units}}, measured from the start of the REM scan, before the REM scan will time out.

parameter.name: ScanStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the current status of this scan.

enumeration.description: The scan has not been executed and there are no valid scan results available

parameter.name: ErrorDetails
parameter.description: Provides more detail when the {{param|ScanStatus}} is either {{enum|Error|ScanStatus}} or {{enum|Error_TIMEOUT|ScanStatus}}.

parameter.name: LastScanTime
parameter.description: The time of the last LTE system radio environment measurement.

parameter.name: MaxCellEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|.REM.LTE.Cell.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: CellNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MaxCarrierMeasEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|.REM.LTE.CarrierMeas.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: CarrierMeasNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.LTE.Cell.{i}.
object.description: Table indicating the components of the discovered cells.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.LTE.Cell.{i}.RF.
object.description: Table indicating the RF aspect of the discovered cells.

parameter.name: EUTRACarrierARFCN
parameter.description: Indicates the ARFCN of this carrier frequency. Corresponds to parameter dl-CarrierFreq in SIB5 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.3.1}}, and parameter NDL in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.101|Section 5.7.3}}.

parameter.name: PhyCellID
parameter.description: Physical cell ID of the detected EUTRAN cell, as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.101|Section 5.6}}.

parameter.name: RSRP
parameter.description: Received RSRP level of the detected EUTRA cell, specified in {{units}}, as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.214|Section 5.1.1}}. The reporting range is specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.133|Section 9.1.4}}.

parameter.name: RSRQ
parameter.description: Received RSRQ level of the detected EUTRA cell, specified in {{units}}, as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.214|Section 5.1.3}}. Actual measured values range between -24.0 {{units}} and 0.0 {{units}} in steps of 0.5 {{units}}. The value of {{param}} divided by 10 yields the actual measured value. Only values in multiple of 5 are valid.

parameter.name: RSSI
parameter.description: E-UTRA Carrier Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI), specified in {{units}}, as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.214|Section 5.1.3}}. It comprises the linear average of the total received power (in [W]) observed only in OFDM symbols containing reference symbols for antenna port 0, in the measurement bandwidth, over N number of resource blocks by the UE from all sources, including co-channel serving and non-serving cells, adjacent channel interference, thermal noise etc.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.LTE.Cell.{i}.BCCH.
object.description: Table containing the system information broadcast in the BCCH logical channel.

parameter.name: DLBandwidth
parameter.description: Downlink transmission bandwidth, specified in number of {{units}}. Corresponds to parameter dl_Bandwidth in Master Information Block in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.2.2}}. and to parameter NRB in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.101|Table 5.6-1}}.

parameter.name: ULBandwidth
parameter.description: Uplink transmission bandwidth, specified in number of {{units}}. Corresponds to parameter ul_Bandwidth in SIB2 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.3.1}}. and to parameter NRB in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.101|Table 5.6-1}}.

parameter.name: RSTxPower
parameter.description: The downlink reference-signal transmit power, specified in {{units}}. Defined as the linear average over the power contributions (in W) of all resource elements that carry cell-specific reference signals within the operating system bandwidth. Corresponds to parameter referenceSignalPower in SIB4 as a part of PDSCH-Config IE in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.3.2}}.

parameter.name: TAC
parameter.description: Tracking Area Code that is common for all the PLMNs listed. Corresponds to trackingAreaCode as specified in SIB1 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.2.2}}.

parameter.name: CellID
parameter.description: Defines the cell identify, defines as a 28-bit binary number. Corresponds to cellIdentity as specified in SIB1 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.2.2 and Section 6.3.4}}.

parameter.name: CellBarred
parameter.description: Indicates whether the cell is barred or not. If {{true}}, the cell is barred. If {{false}}, the cell is not barred. Corresponds to cellBarred as specified in SIB1 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.2.2}} and {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.304}}.

parameter.name: CSGIndication
parameter.description: Indicates whether CSG is used in this cell or not. If {{true}}, the UE is only allowed to access the cell if the CSG identity matches an entry in the allowed CSG list that the UE has stored. Corresponds to csg-Indication as specified in SIB1 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.2.2}}.

parameter.name: CSGIdentity
parameter.description: Defines the CSG ID value if {{param|CSGIndication}} parameter indicates that CSG is used in this cell. Corresponds to csg-Identity as specified in SIB1 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.2.2}}.

parameter.name: MaxPLMNListEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|.REM.LTE.Cell.{i}.BCCH.PLMNList.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: PLMNListNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.LTE.Cell.{i}.BCCH.PLMNList.{i}.
object.description: Table containing the PLMN list in the system information broadcast in the BCCH logical channel. Correspnds to plmn-IdentityList as specified in SIB1 in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.2.2}}. Each instance in this object is a PLMN-IdentityInfo which consists of plmn-Identity and cellReservedForOperatorUse IEs.

parameter.name: PLMNID
parameter.description:
PLMN ID consists of Mobile Country Code (MCC) and Mobile Network Code (MNC) {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.003}}, {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.008}}.
Mobile Country Code consists of three digits and uniquely identifies the country of domicile of the subscriber. Mobile Network Code consists of two or three digits and identifies the Home PLMN within a country. For a 2-digit MNC the total string length of {{param}} is 5.

parameter.name: CellReservedForOperatorUse
parameter.description: Indicates whether the cell is reserved for operator use or not. If {{true}}, it is reserved. If {{false}}, it is not reserved. Corresponds to "reserved" "notReserved" respectively as defined in PLMN-IdentityInfo in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.331|Section 6.2.2}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.LTE.CarrierMeas.{i}.
object.description: Table indicating the measurement of the discovered carrier. The information stored in this object is strictly in the physical layer level and may not necessarily be associated with any particular E-UTRAN cell (e.g. interference level generated by sources other than E-UTRAN cell).

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the CarrierMeas entry.

parameter.name: CarrierARFCNDL
parameter.description: Lower bound of the EUTRA ARFCN as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.101|Section 5.7.3}} in the DL direction that is requested to measure. Unit in {{units}}.

parameter.name: CarrierChWidth
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} in DL direction, as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.101|Section 5.6}}, that is requested to measure. The range bounded by {{param|CarrierARFCNDL}} as the lower bound and the value of ({{param|CarrierARFCNDL}} + {{param}}) as the upper bound expresses the total carrier frequency range to be measured.

parameter.name: CarrierRSSI
parameter.description: Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) as specified in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.36.214|Sec 5.1.3}} over the carrier frequency range from {{param|CarrierARFCNDL}} as the lower bound and the value of ({{param|CarrierARFCNDL}} + {{param|CarrierChWidth}}) as the upper bound.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to radio environment measurement capabilities for the CDMA2000 system.

parameter.name: InServiceHandling
parameter.description: FAP REM behavior with respect to ongoing active connections. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Immediately perform REM, even if have active connections or idle camping AT that may be disrupted.
Wait to initiate REM until no CS bearers or PS bearers of streaming or higher QoS class are assigned.

parameter.name: ScanOnBoot
parameter.description: Enables or disables Radio Environment Measurement during the FAP start up.

parameter.name: ScanNow
parameter.description: Directs FAP to perform radio environment measurements immediately (but respecting the setting of {{param|InServiceHandling}}) and report back. After performing the action, the FAP resets the ScanNow value to "0" ({{false}}).

parameter.name: ReturnTimer
parameter.description: Time in {{units}} within which the action should be performed by the FAP. Only applies if {{param|InServiceHandling}} is set to Delayed.

parameter.name: ScanPeriodically
parameter.description: Enables periodic reporting of radio environment measurements.

parameter.name: PeriodicInterval
parameter.description: When {{param|ScanPeriodically}} is {{true}}, this value indicates the interval in {{units}} which REM is performed while the FAP service is enabled.

parameter.name: PeriodicTime
parameter.description:
An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE will initiate the periodic REM. Each REM MUST occur at (or as soon as possible after) this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|PeriodicInterval}}.
{{param}} is used only to set the "phase" of the REM. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future.
For example, if {{param|PeriodicInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then periodic REMs will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future.
The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|Section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE MAY locally choose the time reference, and needs only to adhere to the specified PeriodicInformInterval.
If absolute time is not available to the CPE, its periodic REM behavior MUST be the same as if {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: ReportOverheads
parameter.description: If {{param}} is set to {{enum|All}}, the FAP shall report the overheads from the sectors as well.

parameter.name: ScanTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the time-out value in {{units}}, measured from the start of the REM scan, before the REM scan will time out.

parameter.name: ScanStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the current status of this scan.

parameter.name: ErrorDetails
parameter.description: Provides more detail when the {{param|ScanStatus}} is either "Error" or "Error_TIMEOUT".

parameter.name: LastScanTime
parameter.description: The time of the last system radio environment measurement.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.OneX.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to radio environment measurement capabilities for the 1x system.

parameter.name: MaxCellEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|.REM.CDMA2000.OneX.Cell.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: CellNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MaxChannelEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|.REM.CDMA2000.OneX.Channel.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: ChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.OneX.Channel.{i}.
object.description: REM specific configuration and reporting.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: SniffingBandClass
parameter.description: Config parameter to set band class. Reference - {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0057}}, Band Class Specification for CDMA2000 Spread Spectrum Systems.

parameter.name: SniffingChannelNumber
parameter.description: The Radio Frequency Channel Number (RFCN) in the forward direction.

parameter.name: PNList
parameter.description: {{list}} Each item is a (single value) PN offset in units of 64 PN chips or PNrange expressed in the following format: <Start-value>".."<End-value>:<Increment> If an empty string, then no specific PNList is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to pick a PN list to scan on its own.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.OneX.Cell.{i}.
object.description: Table indicating the components of the discovered cells.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.OneX.Cell.{i}.RF.
object.description: RF REM results for each detected cell.

parameter.name: Band
parameter.description: CDMA band for the reported cell.

parameter.name: RFCNFL
parameter.description: The Radio Frequency Channel Number (RFCN) in the FL direction for the reported cell.

parameter.name: Io
parameter.description: The total received power spectral density in {{units}}, including signal and interference.

parameter.name: PIlotPN
parameter.description: Pilot PN Offset (in units of {{units}}).

parameter.name: PIlotPNPhase
parameter.description: Pilot PN phase in {{units}}.

parameter.name: PilotStrengthEcp
parameter.description: The strength estimate of the received pilot energy per chip, Ecp, in {{units}}.

parameter.name: PilotStrengthEcpIo
parameter.description: The strength estimate of the received pilot energy per chip, Ecp, to total received spectral density, Io (signal and noise) in {{units}}.

parameter.name: OverheadsAvailable
parameter.description: If set to {{true}}, the overhead messages for this particular cell is included in {{object|.REM.CDMA2000.OneX.Cell.{i}.ControlChannel.}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.OneX.Cell.{i}.ControlChannel.
object.description: Table containing information broadcast on control channel.

parameter.name: SID
parameter.description: System identification. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: NID
parameter.description: Network identification. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: REGZONE
parameter.description: Registration Zone. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: BASELAT
parameter.description: Basestation latitude. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: BASELONG
parameter.description: Basestation longtitude. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: MCC
parameter.description: Mobile Country Code. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: MNCIMSI1112
parameter.description: the 11th and 12th digits of IMSI, i.e., Mobile Network Code. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: BASEID
parameter.description: Basestation identification. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: APID
parameter.description: Access Point Identification. Set to empty string if not available. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: APIDMASK
parameter.description: Access Point Identification Mask. Set to zero if not available. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

parameter.name: APIDTEXT
parameter.description: Access Point Identification Text. Set to empty string if not available. Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0005}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.HRPD.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to radio environment measurement capabilities for the HRPD system.

parameter.name: MaxCellEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|.REM.CDMA2000.HRPD.Cell.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: CellNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MaxChannelEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries in {{object|.REM.CDMA2000.HRPD.Channel.{i}.}} table.

parameter.name: ChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.HRPD.Channel.{i}.
object.description: REM specific configuration and reporting.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: SniffingBandClass
parameter.description: Config parameter to set band class. Reference - {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0057}}, Band Class Specification for CDMA2000 Spread Spectrum Systems.

parameter.name: SniffingChannelNumber
parameter.description: The Radio Frequency Channel Number (RFCN) in the FL direction.

parameter.name: PNList
parameter.description: {{list}} Each item is a (single value) PN offset in units of 64 PN chips or PNrange expressed in the following format: <Start-value>".."<End-value>:<Increment>. If an empty string, then no specific PNList is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to pick a PN list to scan on its own.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.HRPD.Cell.{i}.
object.description: Table indicating the components of the discovered cells.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.HRPD.Cell.{i}.RF.
object.description: RF REM results for each detected cell.

parameter.name: Band
parameter.description: CDMA band for the reported cell.

parameter.name: RFCNFL
parameter.description: The Radio Frequency Channel Number (RFCN) in the FL direction for the reported cell.

parameter.name: Io
parameter.description: The total received power spectral density in {{units}}, including signal and interference.

parameter.name: PIlotPN
parameter.description: Pilot PN Offset (in units of {{units}}).

parameter.name: PIlotPNPhase
parameter.description: Pilot PN phase in {{units}}.

parameter.name: PilotStrengthEcp
parameter.description: The strength estimate of the received pilot energy per chip in {{units}}.

parameter.name: PilotStrengthEcpIo
parameter.description: The strength estimate of the received pilot energy per chip, Ecp, to total received spectral density, Io (signal and noise) in {{units}}.

parameter.name: OverheadsAvailable
parameter.description: If set to {{true}}, the overhead messages for this particular cell is included in {{object|.REM.CDMA2000.HRPD.Cell.{i}.ControlChannel.}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.HRPD.Cell.{i}.ControlChannel.
object.description: Table containing information braodcast on control channel.

parameter.name: ColorCode
parameter.description: The color code of the measured sector as defined in {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024}}.

parameter.name: SectorID
parameter.description: The sector ID of the measured sector as defined in {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024}}.

parameter.name: SubnetMask
parameter.description: The length of the subnet mask in {{units}} for the measured sector as defined in {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024}}.

parameter.name: CountryCode
parameter.description: The country code of the measured sector as defined in {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024}}.

parameter.name: Latitude
parameter.description: The reported lattitude of the cell in units of {{units}}, expressed as a two's complement signed number with positive numbers signifying North latitudes in the range -1296000 to 1296000 inclusive corresponding to a range of -90 to +90) Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024}}.

parameter.name: Longitude
parameter.description: The reported longitude of the cell in units of {{units}}, expressed as a two's complement signed number with positive numbers signifying East longitude in the range -2592000 to 2592000 inclusive (corresponding to a range of -180 to +180). Refer to {{bibref|3GPP2-C.S0024}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.MacroTiming.
object.description: Parameters for controlling CDMA2000 system timing derived from macro system sniffing.

parameter.name: AdminState
parameter.description: This is the Admin State of Macro Timing. Lock means MacroTiming feature is Enabled. Unlock means MacroTiming feature is disabled. 0 - Lock (Enabled), 1 - Unlock (Disabled).

parameter.name: TrackingChannelNumber
parameter.description: Channel number of Macro Base Station currently used for MacroTiming.

parameter.name: TrackingBandClass
parameter.description: BandClass of Macro Base Station currently used for MacroTiming.

parameter.name: TrackingPNOffset
parameter.description: {{list}} Each item is a (single value) PN offset in units of 64 PN chips of a Macro Base Station currently used for MacroTiming.

parameter.name: TimingSource
parameter.description:
This parameter indicates the timing source for the FAP:
0 - GPS
1 - Macro Timing
The other read-only parameters in this object only have valid values when timingsource is set to 1.

parameter.name: ChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.REM.CDMA2000.MacroTiming.Channel.{i}.
object.description: Object used to configure list of channels to be used for Macto Timing.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: AirInterfaceType
parameter.description: Air interface type of the configured Band class and Channel. 0 - 1x, 1 - HRPD.

parameter.name: BandClass
parameter.description: Bandclass of the Macro timing channel.

parameter.name: ChannelNumber
parameter.description: Macro timing acquisition channel.

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.description: Priority of the channle to use for acquisition. FAP should prioritize lower values over higher.

parameter.name: PNList
parameter.description:
{{list}} Each item is a (single value) PN offset in units of 64 PN chips or PNrange expressed in the following format:
<Start-value>".."<End-value>:<Increment>
If an empty string, then no specific PNList is provided, meaning that the FAP is required to pick a PN list to scan on its own.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to the transport.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.SIP.
object.description:
This object contains parameters relating to SIP as a transport protocol.
SIP is defined in {{bibref|RFC3261}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the whole SIP object and allows the setup or release of SIP associations and their related streams.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.SIP.FCS.
object.description: This object models SIP Femtocell Convergence Server (FCS) parameters.

parameter.name: FCSURI
parameter.description:
The request URI for MESSAGE method sent to Femtocell Convergence Server (FCS). The string MUST contain a URI as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}.
The device MUST support SIP URI and MAY support other URI schemes.

parameter.name: OutGoingProxyURI
parameter.description:
The request URI for Outgoing Proxy. The string MUST contain a URI as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}.
The device MUST support SIP URI and MAY support other URI schemes.

parameter.name: PAccessNetInfoHeader
parameter.description:
This string will be populated as the value for P-Access-Network-Info header.
This header is generated by the device. See {{bibref|3GPP2-X.S0059}} and {{bibref|RFC3455}}.

parameter.name: Realm
parameter.description:
The FQDN or IP Address representing the Home Domain of the device.
The request URI for REGISTER will be formed by prefixing "sip:" to this value.

parameter.name: IMPU
parameter.description: The "IP Multimedia Public User" (IMPU) Identity.

parameter.name: IMPI
parameter.description:
The "IP Multimedia Private Identity" (IMPI).
This value is ignored when {{param|SIPAuthMethod}} is set to {{enum|TNA|SIPAuthMethod}}.

parameter.name: SIPPassword
parameter.description:
Password to Authenticate the IMS core.
This value is ignored when {{param|SIPAuthMethod}} is set to {{enum|TNA|SIPAuthMethod}}.

parameter.name: SIPAuthCapability
parameter.description: Represents the SIP authentication mechanisms supported by this device.

enumeration.description: As defined in {{bibref|3GPP2-S.S0132}}.
Digest Authentication as defined in {{bibref|RFC3261}}.

parameter.name: SIPAuthMethod
parameter.description:
Represents the authentication method used by this device for SIP registration.
If value is {{enum|SIPDigest}}, the {{param|SIPPassword}} MUST not be {{empty}}.
If value is {{enum|TNA}}, {{param|SIPPassword}} and {{param|IMPI}} are ignored.

parameter.name: SIPLocalPort
parameter.description: Local port number for initiating SIP traffic.

parameter.name: RTPPortLowLimit
parameter.description: The low limit of port number for originating and receiving RTP/RTCP traffic.

parameter.name: RTPPortHighLimit
parameter.description: The high limit of port number for originating and receiving RTP/RTCP traffic.

parameter.name: SIPRegExpiry
parameter.description: SIP registration expiry value, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3261}}.

parameter.name: SIPSessionExpiry
parameter.description: SIP session timer expiry value, in {{units}}, as defined in {{bibref|RFC4028}}.

parameter.name: EmergencyNumbersList
parameter.description: Indicates the dialed digit pattern matching strings used to determine if the call is an emergency call that MAY bypass access control and receive priority treatment.

parameter.name: TimerT1
parameter.description: Value of SIP timer T1, in {{units}}, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3261}}.

parameter.name: TimerT2
parameter.description: Value of SIP timer T2, in {{units}}, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3261}}.

parameter.name: TimerT4
parameter.description: Value of SIP timer T4, in {{units}}, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3261}}.

parameter.name: T3210
parameter.description: This value specifies how much time to wait, in {{units}}, before time out on location update accept/reject. See {{bibref|3GPP2-A.S0014}}.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.SCTP.
object.description:
This object contains parameters relating to SCTP as a transport protocol.
SCTP is defined in {{bibref|RFC4960}} and {{bibref|RFC3873}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the whole SCTP object and allows the setup or release of SCTP associations and their related streams.

parameter.name: HBInterval
parameter.description: Heartbeat interval in {{units}}.

parameter.name: MaxAssociationRetransmits
parameter.description: Maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a peer before an endpoint considers that the peer is unreachable and closes the association.

parameter.name: MaxInitRetransmits
parameter.description: Number of retransmission per connection-attempt.

parameter.name: MaxPathRetransmits
parameter.description: Maximum retransmission per destination address.

parameter.name: RTOInitial
parameter.description: Initial value for Retransmit timeout in {{units}}. A retransmission time value of zero means immediate retransmission.

parameter.name: RTOMax
parameter.description: Maximum value for Retransmit timeout in {{units}}. A retransmission time value of zero means immediate retransmission.

parameter.name: RTOMin
parameter.description:
Minimum value for Retransmit timeout in {{units}}. A retransmission time value of zero means immediate retransmission.
The value of this parameter MUST be lower than or equal to {{param|RTOMax}}.

parameter.name: ValCookieLife
parameter.description: Valid cookie life in the 4-way start-up handshake procedure in {{units}}.

parameter.name: OutOfBlues
parameter.description: The number of correctly formed SCTP packets, including the proper checksum, but for which the receiver was unable to identify an appropriate association.

parameter.name: ChecksumErrors
parameter.description: The number of SCTP packets received with an invalid checksum.

parameter.name: OutCtrlChunks
parameter.description: The number of SCTP control chunks sent (retransmissions are not included).

parameter.name: OutOrderChunks
parameter.description: The number of SCTP ordered data chunks sent (retransmissions are not included).

parameter.name: OutUnorderChunks
parameter.description: The number of SCTP unordered chunks (data chunks in which the U bit is set to 1) sent (retransmissions are not included).

parameter.name: InCtrlChunks
parameter.description: The number of SCTP control chunks received (no duplicate chunks included).

parameter.name: InOrderChunks
parameter.description: The number of SCTP ordered data chunks received (no duplicate chunks included).

parameter.name: InUnorderChunks
parameter.description: The number of SCTP unordered chunks (data chunks in which the U bit is set to 1) received (no duplicate chunks included).

parameter.name: FragUsrMsgs
parameter.description: The number of user messages that have been sent fragmented.

parameter.name: ReasmUsrMsgs
parameter.description: The number of user messages that have been received fragmented and submitted to the reassembly process.

parameter.name: OutSCTPPacks
parameter.description: The number of SCTP packets sent. Retransmitted DATA chunks are included.

parameter.name: InSCTPPacks
parameter.description: The number of SCTP packets received. Duplicates are included.

parameter.name: Discontinuity
parameter.description: The time of the last discontinuity.

parameter.name: AssocNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.SCTP.Assoc.{i}.
object.description: SCTP Association Table

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this SCTP association entry.

enumeration.description: The Association is active.
The Association establishment is in progress.
The Association graceful shutdown is in progress.
Indicates a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: PrimaryPeerAddress
parameter.description: The primary IP address of the peer SCTP association entity.

parameter.name: LocalPort
parameter.description: The local SCTP port number used for this SCTP association.

parameter.name: InStreams
parameter.description: The number of Inbound Streams according to the negotiation at association start-up.

parameter.name: OutStreams
parameter.description: The number of Outbound Streams according to the negotiation at association start-up.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: The start Time for the present SCTP association.

parameter.name: Discontinuity
parameter.description: The time of the last discontinuity.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.RealTime.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to Real Time Transport using RTP.

parameter.name: RTCPEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable RTCP.

parameter.name: SentPackets
parameter.description: The number of sent RTP packets.

parameter.name: RcvPackets
parameter.description: The number of received RTP packets.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of RTP payload bytes sent.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of RTP payload bytes received.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.RealTime.Perf.
object.description: This object contains performances relating to Real Time Transport using RTP.

parameter.name: LostRcvPackets
parameter.description: The number of Lost RTP packets in reception.

parameter.name: LostFarEndPackets
parameter.description: The number of Far End Lost RTP packets.

parameter.name: Overruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the receive jitter buffer has overrun.

parameter.name: Underruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the receive jitter buffer has underrun for a CS-domain RAB.

parameter.name: MeanRTT
parameter.description: The mean Round Trip Time in {{units}} as computed by the source. {{bibref|RFC3550}}

parameter.name: MaxRTT
parameter.description: The maximum Round Trip Time in {{units}} as computed by the source. {{bibref|RFC3550}}

parameter.name: MeanReceiveJitter
parameter.description: The mean receive jitter in {{units}} as computed by the source. {{bibref|RFC3550}}

parameter.name: MaxReceiveJitter
parameter.description: The maximum receive jitter in {{units}} as computed by the source. {{bibref|RFC3550}}

parameter.name: MeanFarEndJitter
parameter.description: The mean far end jitter in {{units}} as computed by the source. {{bibref|RFC3550}}

parameter.name: MaxFarEndJitter
parameter.description: The maximum far end jitter in {{units}} as computed by the source. {{bibref|RFC3550}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.Packet.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to Packet Transport using GTP-U.

parameter.name: EchoInterval
parameter.description: Echo interval in {{units}}. An Echo interval value of zero means echo is disabled.

parameter.name: SentPackets
parameter.description: The number of sent GTP-U packets.

parameter.name: RcvPackets
parameter.description: The number of received GTP-U packets.

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.Security.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to Security.

parameter.name: SecretNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: FAPService.{i}.Transport.Security.Secret.{i}.
object.description: Shared Secret Table. This table gathers information about all types of shared secret-based credentials (UICC).

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable this Shared Secret entry

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: The type of this Shared Secret entry.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this Shared Secret entry.

enumeration.description: This value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: UICCCardID
parameter.description: The UICC Card Identifier (UICCID), only numeric values are allowed. {{bibref|ITU-E.118}}
